headlines: 'Non-compete' clause in offer letter won't limit career growth: Infosys after backlash
text: Infosys, facing backlash for its 'non-compete' clause in offer letters to the employees, on Wednesday said that it won't limit the employees' career growth. The agreement reportedly says that an employee shall not accept an employment offer from "named competitors" for six months after they quit Infosys. The company reportedly named TCS, Wipro, and other major IT firms as competitors.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Netflix shares crash over 35% in their biggest fall in more than 10 years
text: Netflix shares crashed over 35% on Wednesday in their biggest drop since October 2011. The stock crashed after Netflix reported losing 2,00,000 customers in Q1 2022, marking the first time in more than 10 years that the company lost subscribers. At the time of writing, Netflix shares were trading at $224.68, shedding over a third of their value.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: What reasons did Netflix give for losing members for the first time in 10 years?
text: Netflix revealed that 2,00,000 people left the streaming service in the first three months of the year, marking its first fall in subscribers in more than 10 years. Netflix gave several reasons including COVID-19 disruptions, account sharing, sluggish economic growth, increasing inflation, and Russia's invasion of Ukraine for slower growth. It also cited competition from YouTube, Amazon, and Hulu.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Netflix loses subscribers for 1st time in more than 10 years
text: The number of Netflix subscribers has fallen for the first time in more than a decade. The streaming company lost 200,000 members in the first three months of the year, the company said on Tuesday. Netflix's shares, already down more than 40% this year, tumbled as much as 27% to $256 in after-hours trading.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Nissan to discontinue Datsun brand in India
text: Nissan is discontinuing Datsun brand in India, the company said on Wednesday. India was one of the last markets where Datsun was still operational after its global relaunch failed and it was discontinued in Russia and Indonesia in 2020. "Datsun redi-GO production has ceased at the Chennai plant...sales of the model still continue (till the stock lasts)," Nissan India said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: China doubles purchase of Russian coking coal amid discount
text: China more than doubled imports of coking coal from Russia in March, buying it at a discount as other nations ban Russian imports due to the Russia-Ukraine war. China's coking coal imports from Russia jumped to 1.4 million tonnes in March 2022, compared to 5,50,000 tonnes for March 2021. Coking coal is essential for the production of iron and steel.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Blackstone, Vista rule out financing Musk's $43 bn Twitter bid: Report
text: Private equity firms Blackstone and Vista Equity Partners have ruled out financing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid to buy Twitter, Bloomberg reported. Brookfield Asset Management has also decided not to finance the bid. Blackstone and Vista have decided not to finance any potential bid for Twitter, even if it's from another party besides Musk, at the moment.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Elon Musk willing to invest up to $15 billion of own money to buy Twitter: Report
text: Elon Musk is willing to invest between $10 billion and $15 billion of his own money to take Twitter Inc private, the New York Post reported citing two sources. The Tesla CEO and world's richest man, who is Twitter's second-biggest shareholder with a 9.1% stake, is planning to launch an offer in about 10 days, the report added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Ackman sells $1.1 bn Netflix stock at $400 mn loss after shares fall 35%
text: Billionaire Bill Ackman has sold his entire stock worth $1.1 billion in Netflix at over $400 million loss three months after acquiring the position. Netflix shares crashed over 35% on Wednesday in their biggest drop since October 2011. "We have lost confidence in our ability to predict the company's future prospects with a sufficient degree of certainty," Ackman said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Woke mind virus making Netflix unwatchable: Musk as Netflix loses members
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "The woke mind virus is making Netflix unwatchable." The tweet came after Netflix reported losing subscribers for the first time in more than 10 years. When a Twitter user said, "Not just Netflix. Movies in general, videogames, TV, they're all infested with current year trend woke garbage," Musk responded, "True".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody in India: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her US visit on Monday said, "No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody (in India)." She said, "The one big step the government decided was we shall not tax people to get out of the pandemic." Calling the building of infrastructure "best multiplier for economic recovery", she added, "Capital expenditure was our route to recovery."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India to provide additional $500 million to Sri Lanka to buy fuel
text: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister GL Peiris on Wednesday said India will provide an additional $500 million in financial assistance to the country for it to buy fuel. Previously, India sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka, taking the total supply of various types of fuels under Indian assistance to Sri Lanka to 2,70,000 MT.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LV Vaidyanathan, who joined P&G as an intern, appointed India CEO
text: Consumer goods company Procter & Gamble (P&G) on Tuesday announced that it has appointed LV Vaidyanathan as the CEO for its operations in India. Vaidyanathan is an alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad and had joined P&G as an intern in 1995. The 49-year-old is currently leading the P&G business in Indonesia. Vaidyanathan succeeds Madhusudan Gopalan, who'll move to a global role.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹2.58 lakh crore wiped off HDFC & HDFC Bank's market value in 9-day sell-off
text: As much as ₹2.58 lakh crore has been wiped out of the combined market value of HDFC Ltd and HDFC Bank in a nine-day sell-off. The development comes after the two companies announced their merger earlier this month. HDFC Ltd, which was among India's top 10 most valuable companies prior to the announcement, is no longer on the list.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Zoho's billionaire CEO shares pics of office made with mud/straw, says 'I love it so much'
text: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu took to Twitter to share pictures of his company's new conference room and small offices. He wrote, "New conference room and small offices, built with mud/straw and limestone cover, upstairs covered by thatched palm leaf. Comfortable even on a hot day." He added, "I love it so much I have made it my office!"
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Germany rejects Russia's demand to pay for natural gas in rubles
text: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner on Wednesday said companies buying Russian natural gas shouldn't have to set up ruble accounts to pay for it. "Contracts are based on dollars and euros and so private-sector companies should pay in dollars or euros," Lindner said. Last month, Russian President Vladimir Putin had demanded "unfriendly countries" to pay for Russian gas in rubles.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tata Steel to stop business with Russia over Ukraine invasion
text: Tata Steel has taken a "conscious" decision to stop doing business with Russia, the steel major said on Wednesday amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. It stated, "Tata Steel doesn't have any operations or employees in Russia." All of the company's manufacturing sites in India, the UK and the Netherlands have sourced alternative supplies of raw materials, it added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Netflix may offer cheaper ad-supported plans amid subscriber loss
text: Netflix is thinking about offering a lower-priced version of the service with advertising amid a fall in the number of subscribers for the first time in over a decade. Netflix CEO Reed Hastings said that even though he's been "against the complexity of advertising", he's a "bigger fan of consumer choice". Netflix lost 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Jio loses mobile subscribers for 3rd straight month; Airtel gains
text: Reliance Jio lost 36.6 lakh mobile subscribers in February, the first time that it has lost subscribers for the third consecutive month, data by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) showed. Meanwhile, Bharti Airtel, the only telco to gain subscribers in February, added 15.91 lakh new customers. Vodafone Idea lost 15.32 lakh users while BSNL lost 1.11 lakh customers.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Uber hikes fare rates by 10% in Bengaluru amid rise in fuel prices
text: Uber has announced a 10% hike in its fare rates in Bengaluru amid a rise in fuel prices. An official said the move was "to help cushion drivers from the impact of a spike in fuel prices", adding it'll continue to track fuel prices and take further steps as needed. Ola is yet to take a decision on hiking fares.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Target not breached 'so badly': FM on 17-month-high inflation
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said India hasn't breached the inflation target "so badly". Her statement came after India's retail inflation rose to a 17-month high of about 6.95% in March against 6.07% in February. "Our tolerance band is just 4%, plus or minus 2%...So we might go as much as 6%," she stated during her US visit.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Adani to invest ₹10,000 crore in West Bengal, to create 25,000 jobs
text: Adani Group Chairman and Founder Gautam Adani has announced that the company will invest around ₹10,000 crore in West Bengal in the next few years. "This will provide direct and indirect employment to around 25,000 people," Adani stated. He added that the investment will be made in sectors like under-sea cable, data centre and warehouses.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Inflation in Russia rises to 17.62%, highest since 2002
text: Inflation in Russia rose to 17.62% as of April 15, its highest since 2002, the Economic Development Ministry said on Wednesday. Inflation in Russia slowed to 0.2% in the week ending April 15, taking the year-to-date increase in consumer prices to 11.05%, statistics service Rosstat said. Inflation could reach between 17-20%, Russian Accounts Chamber Chairman Alexei Kudrin said last week.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: HDFC to sell 10% stake in HDFC Capital for ₹184 crore
text: HDFC on Wednesday announced that it's selling a 10% stake in its private equity arm HDFC Capital Advisors to a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) for about ₹184 crore. HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said ADIA's investment will enable HDFC Capital to leverage ADIA's global expertise. HDFC had announced its merger with HDFC Bank earlier this month.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Real estate prices may increase by 10-15% across India: CREDAI
text: Real estate industry body CREDAI on Tuesday said real estate prices have increased 5-8% due to a rise in construction costs and are expected to rise further by 5-7%. There's been a steady increase in raw material costs in last two years, CREDAI National President HV Patodia said. The Ukraine war has caused a further rise in costs, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala cuts stake in SAIL from 1.09% to 0.32%
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala cut his stake in the Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) during the January-March quarter, data on the company's website showed. As of January 14, Rekha Jhunjhunwala, Rakesh's wife, owned a 0.49% stake in SAIL while Rakesh Jhunjhunwala owned a 0.32% stake. He had earlier cut his stake from 1.76% to 1.09% in December 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Oil drops below the $110 mark after IMF cuts global growth forecast
text: Oil price dipped below the $110 mark on Tuesday after the International Monetary Fund (IMF) reduced its global growth forecast and warned of higher inflation. Brent crude fell $3.94 to $109.22/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $3.8 to $104.41/barrel. IMF had said growth in emerging markets and developed economies could reduce by 1.3% and 0.9% over three years.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt to continue 15-day fare limit on air travel: Civil Aviation Minister Scindia
text: The Ministry of Civil Aviation imposed a fare cap for 15 days on air travel due to the pandemic. Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday said, "If we talk about the fare caps, then it is my responsibility to the passengers as well as to the airlines...The decision to remove it will be taken at an appropriate time."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: IMF cuts India's GDP growth forecast sharply from 9% to 8.2% for FY23
text: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has sharply cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 8.2% from 9%, citing Russia-Ukraine war. "Economic damage from the conflict will contribute to a significant slowdown in global growth in 2022 and add to inflation," the IMF said in its World Economic Outlook report. IMF cut its global growth outlook for 2022 to 3.6%.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: HDFC no longer among India's top 10 most valuable companies
text: India's largest housing finance company HDFC Ltd is no longer among the top 10 most valuable companies of India in terms of market capitalisation. The shares of HDFC have plunged nearly 19% after the announcement of its merger with HDFC Bank earlier this month. Meanwhile, HDFC Bank is the third most valuable company of India after Reliance Industries and TCS.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.1%, EMIs to go up
text: India's biggest lender State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points, or 0.1%, across all loan tenors. With the increase, EMIs will go up for those borrowers who availed loans on MCLR. After the SBI, Kotak Mahindra, Bank of Baroda and Axis Bank also announced an increase in MCLR.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Biggest risk of cryptocurrency will be money laundering, terror financing: Sitharaman
text: The biggest risk of cryptocurrency would be money laundering and its use for financing terror, said Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. "I think regulation using technology is the only answer. Regulation using technology will have to be so adept, that it has to be not behind the curve, but be sure that it is on the top of it," she added.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: No changes made: Google on claims it 'stopped hiding' Russian military facilities
text: Google has denied claims by many Google Maps users that it has 'stopped hiding' Russia's secret military facilities. Many users shared satellite pics of the facilities saying that they've been 'unblurred', giving anyone a view of the installations and command posts amid Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We haven't made any blurring changes to our satellite imagery in Russia," said Google.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Amazon, Reliance, Dream11 & Sony may compete for IPL broadcast rights: Report
text: Amazon, The Walt Disney Company and Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries are among the companies that have signalled an intention to bid for the rights to telecast IPL matches to be held between 2023 and 2027, Bloomberg reported. Sony, Zee and Dream11 also purchased the bid-related documents from BCCI, it added. BCCI will be conducting the online auction starting June 12.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: If I don't use a plane, I have less hours to work: World's richest man Musk
text: World's richest man Elon Musk has said that he does not spend "billions of dollars a year" in personal consumption. Stating that his personal consumption is not high, Musk said in a TED interview, "The one exception is a plane, but if I don't use the plane, then I have less hours to work." He added, "I don't...really take vacations."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Nothing to say: Ex-Twitter CEO on why he didn't do anything about 'dysfunctional' board
text: After former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey tweeted that their board has "consistently been the dysfunction" of the company, a US journalist argued why he hadn't done anything about it when he ran the firm. Replying to him, Dorsey tweeted, "So much to say…but nothing that can be said." Dorsey's remarks come amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: CoinDCX doubles valuation to $2.15 bn, becomes India's most valuable crypto company
text: CoinDCX has raised $135.9 million in a funding round led by Pantera Capital and Steadview Capital. This led to its valuation being doubled to $2.15 billion in eight months to become the most valued cryptocurrency trading platform in India. CoinDCX plans to use its fund to increase its employees from 400 to 1000 by the end of next year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Zepto starts 10-min snacks delivery in Mumbai, CEO clarifies 'Not delivering food'
text: Zepto has started a 10-minute delivery of snacks in Mumbai. It has collaborated with restaurants such as Blue Tokai Coffee and Chaayos for the delivery of items like tea, coffee, and croissants, among others. Meanwhile, Aadit Palicha, CEO of Zepto clarified that they are not delivering food but only ready-to-drink coffee, tea, and packaged snacks.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Japan fast food chain fires MD for saying 'get virgins' addicted to their food
text: Japan's fast-food chain Yoshinoya, known for its inexpensive bowls of beef on rice, has fired its managing director over his alleged derogatory remarks toward women. Masaki Ito during a university lecture apparently said that the company should try to "get virgins addicted" to Yoshinoya’s food because "once men treat them to expensive meals they won't eat beef bowls anymore".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Which are the world's most affordable and least affordable cities to buy home?
text: The US city of Pittsburgh is the most affordable city for buying a house, according to the Demographia International Housing Affordability's study on housing prices for 92 major markets (metropolitan areas). It's followed by Oklahoma City and Rochester in the US, Edmonton in Canada and St. Louis in the US. Hong Kong emerged as the least affordable city for housing.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Reliance Brands acquires 51% majority stake in Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla
text: Reliance Brands Limited (RBL) has acquired a majority stake in luxury fashion label Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla. RBL has signed a definitive agreement to invest in the prominent couture brand for a 51% stake. The company has recently set up a ready-to-wear fashion venture with Delhi-based designer Rahul Mishra and also acquired a 40% stake in Manish Malhotra.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as HDFC drops out of the list?
text: Reliance Industries is India's most valuable company with a market value of ₹17.84 lakh crore, followed by TCS (₹12.71 lakh crore) and HDFC Bank (₹7.44 lakh crore). The list includes Infosys, ICICI Bank, Hindustan Unilever, SBI, Adani Green Energy and Bajaj Finance. Bharti Airtel is India's 10th most valuable company after HDFC Ltd dropped out of the list on Tuesday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SBI asks FRL about steps taken to get back stores from Reliance: Report
text: State Bank of India (SBI) has written a letter to Future Retail (FRL) seeking accountability on the takeover of the company's stores by Reliance Industries, BloombergQuint reported. SBI has asked FRL what steps it has taken to safeguard lenders' interests and the efforts taken to get back its assets from Reliance. Reliance took over 947 Future Group stores last month.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Adani Green Energy overtakes SBI as India's 7th most valuable company
text: Adani Green Energy overtook the State Bank of India (SBI) on Monday to become the country's seventh most valuable company. The company's shares have surged over 120% year-to-date and its market valuation currently stands at ₹4.64 lakh crore. Adani Green is the only non-Sensex company featuring in the list of top 10 companies on BSE in terms of market capitalisation.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: New Zealand imposes new sanctions on Russian financial institutions
text: New Zealand Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta on Tuesday said the country is imposing new sanctions on Russian financial institutions such as eight of its largest banks over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Mahuta said New Zealand is imposing sanctions on "18 financial entities, including Russia's central bank, sovereign wealth fund and the largest financial institutions in the country".
author: Veer Badani

headlines: Sounds high: Musk on Meta spending $26.8 mn on Zuckerberg's security
text: World's richest person Elon Musk in response to a story on Meta spending $26.8 million on CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021 said, "Sounds high." The figure was reportedly 6% higher than $25.3 million spent in 2020. Private travel and costs associated with security protocols due to the COVID-19 were cited as reasons for such costs in 2021.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Jack Ma's Ant to be payments platform 2C2P's largest shareholder
text: Jack Ma-owned Ant Group will become the majority investor in Singapore-based payments platform 2C2P as part of a partnership. The deal will lead to the integration of Ant's Alipay+ payment service with 2C2P's platform used by merchants in Asia, Europe, the Middle East and the Americas. "Through this...partnership...2C2P will be connected to a much larger merchant base," 2C2P CEO said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Govt revising all testing norms for EV batteries & cells: Reports
text: The government is revising all testing norms for batteries, battery management and cells after multiple EV scooters caught fire across India, CNBC-TV18 reported. The government is holding a dialogue with companies connected with the fire incidents. Okinawa, Ola, Jitendra Electric and Pure EV are being advised on steps that need to be taken to prevent such fires in future.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers: SC tells banks
text: The Supreme Court has directed banks to waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers with outstanding loans and standardise their accounts. "No penalty will be charged from the homebuyers by banks since the default was on part of the builder and not by the buyers," the bench said. In 2019, the court cancelled the registration of Amrapali Group for defrauding homebuyers.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BBMP offers 5% rebate on property tax if people pay it before Apr 30
text: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta has announced that people can get a 5% rebate if they pay their property tax for the 2022-23 financial year before April 30. According to BBMP, property owners would've to pay the full amount in one instalment in order to avail the rebate. The amount can be paid using BBMP's website.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: In talks with India to find solution on payments: Russian diplomat
text: Consul General of Russia in Mumbai AV Surovtsev said Russia is in talks with the Indian government and Reserve Bank of India to find a solution on the payments front. Due to its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has been cut off from the international payments system SWIFT. "Complicated situation" created by the sanctions creates room for Indian exports, Surovtsev added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030. Describing the Indian economy's recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic as "distinct" and "pronounced", Sitharaman said India undertook various structural reforms both before and after the pandemic. India converted the pandemic into an opportunity to further push these reforms, she added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Indian economy not immune to Ukraine war, inflation on the cards: RBI
text: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said as the Russia-Ukraine war continues to affect the global supply chain and inflate prices, the Indian economy is expected to not remain immune either. India's high inflation and widening trade deficit are expected to hamper growth and lead to "rocketing inflation", RBI added. Retail inflation rose to a 17-month high of 6.95% in March.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ₹48,000 cr wiped off Infosys' m-cap in a day as shares plunge the most in 2 years
text: The shares of Infosys plunged over 9% on Monday during the intra-day trade, wiping out ₹48,000 crore from the company's market capital. At 9%, Infosys stock had the biggest fall in the market since March 23, 2020. This comes after several analysts cut Infosys margin estimates over its weaker-than-expected earnings for the March quarter.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: WPI inflation rises to record 14.55% in Mar, Govt cites Russia-Ukraine war as reason
text: India's Wholesale Price-based Inflation (WPI) has surged to a record high of 14.55% in March. The Centre has said that the high rate of inflation in March is due to "the rise in prices of crude petroleum and natural gas, mineral oils, basic metals" caused by the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Notably, In March 2021, the WPI was 7.89%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Amway India's assets worth ₹758 crore attached by ED over pyramid fraud
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹757.77 crore belonging to Amway India Enterprises Private Limited. According to ED, the firm was running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing networks. Amway India said, "The action is with regards to the investigation dating back to 2011 and since then we've been cooperating with the department."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I don't own a home, I stay at friends' places: World's richest man Elon Musk
text: Elon Musk, the world's richest person with a net worth of over $250 billion, said, "I don't even own a home right now...I'm literally staying at friends' places." He added, "If I travel to the Bay Area, which is where most of Tesla engineering is, I basically rotate through friends' spare bedrooms." Musk also said, "I don't have a yacht."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: If philanthropy is love of humanity, my companies are philanthropy: Musk
text: World's richest man Elon Musk said SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink and The Boring Company, the companies that he has founded, are philanthropy. "If you say philanthropy is love of humanity, they are philanthropy," Musk added. Asked about his views on billionaire philanthropy, he said, "If you care about reality of goodness instead of the perception of it, philanthropy is extremely difficult."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Speculative in nature: Mindtree on report of $22 bn merger with L&T Infotech
text: Mindtree on Monday clarified that news reports of its merger with Larsen & Toubro Infotech are "speculative in nature". Mindtree said, "We would like to state that there is no information available with the company as of today." Bloomberg earlier reported that Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between the two software firms to create a $22 billion firm.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: It has consistently been the dysfunction of the company: Dorsey on Twitter board
text: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey said Twitter's board has "consistently been the dysfunction of the company". He was replying to a tweet that said the company's board has been "mired in plots and coups...particularly amongst Twitter's founding members". On being further asked if he is allowed to say this, Dorsey replied, "No."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS: CEO
text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) CEO Rajesh Gopinathan called the current scramble for employees "transitory" and argued that, ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS, Bloomberg reported. He said that TCS enjoys the highest structural margins. "We enjoy the benefit of occupying the high point on the profitability side...everybody else is benchmarked below us," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: L&T Infotech, Mindtree may merge into a $22 billion firm: Report
text: Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between its publicly traded software firms, Larsen & Toubro Infotech and Mindtree, to create a $22 billion firm, Bloomberg reported. The boards of the two companies could consider share swap ratios for the merger as early as next week. L&T acquired Mindtree in 2019 and holds about a 61% stake in the company.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter board members' salary will be $0 if I acquire the company: Musk
text: World's richest person Elon Musk said on Monday that Twitter's board of directors will not receive any compensation if he succeeds in acquiring the company. "Board salary will be $0 if my bid succeeds, so that's ~$3 million/year saved right there," he tweeted. Twitter currently spends about $2.9 million in cash and stock awards to board members, as per filings.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bitcoin falls to lowest in a month, global crypto market's value falls to $1.9 trillion
text: The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as much as 4.2% to $38,580 and the second-largest cryptocurrency, Ether, dropped 4.7% to as low as $2,902 on Monday. The global crypto market’s value dropped about 4% in the past 24 hours to $1.9 trillion, according to the pricing from CoinGecko. Bitcoin has been struggling along with risk assets in recent months.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Swiggy, Zomato back startup UrbanPiper in $24 mn funding round
text: Restaurant management platform UrbanPiper has raised $24 million in a funding round led by existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Tiger Global, along with new investors Swiggy and Zomato. The Bengaluru-based startup is a B2B software platform with over 27,000 hotels and restaurants live on its platform. UrbanPiper claims to process 18% of all online food orders in India.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Mahindra praises Mumbai's new bus stops with exercise bars, 'cool' green tops
text: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday took to Twitter to share a video about 105 Mumbai bus stops that are set to be revamped. The new bus stops will be cleaner, safer, sleeker, and feature plant-covered roofs and exercise bars. "Terrific to also see innovative features like the exercise bar & the 'cool' green tops," Mahindra tweeted.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex crashes 1,000 points in early trade, Nifty below 17,200
text: The Sensex tanked over 1,000 points in early trade on Monday while the NSE Nifty 50 dipped below 17,200 amid weak global cues. The indices reopened on April 18 after a gap of four straight days on account of public holidays. Infosys and HDFC Bank tanked 6% and 2.4% respectively, on account of their Q4 earnings.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Hong Kong bans Air India flights till April 24 after 3 found COVID positive
text: Hong Kong has banned Air India services till April 24 after three passengers on one of its flights tested positive for COVID-19 post arrival on Saturday, an official said. "Due to restrictions imposed by Hong Kong authorities and limited demand on the sector, our flights to Hong Kong & back of 19th and 23rd April stand cancelled," Air India tweeted.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Evergreen's 'Ever Forward' ship freed over a month after running aground in US
text: Evergreen Marine Corporation's giant container ship 'Ever Forward' has been freed more than a month after it ran aground in Chesapeake Bay, US. The ship's navigational status changed to "under way using engine" on Sunday from being classified as "aground" on March 13. Last year, Evergreen's 'Ever Given' ship got stuck in the Suez Canal, disrupting global shipping for months.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sensex crashes 1,170 points to end at 57,166 dragged by IT stocks
text: The Sensex plunged 1,172 points on Monday to close at 57,166, while the Nifty fell 302 points to end below 17,200, at 17,173. Most sectoral indices were trading lower today with the IT index declining nearly 5%, and realty and bank indices down 1% each. Infosys, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra and Apollo Hospitals were among the top Nifty losers.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Infosys shares fall 9% in intra-day trade post Q4 results, its biggest fall in 2 yrs
text: Infosys' shares dropped 9% to ₹1592.05 on the BSE in Monday's intra-day trade owing to its weak Q4 results, making this its biggest fall in the market in two years. The plunge wiped out ₹47,907.7 crore from its market valuation. Earlier on March 23, 2020, Infosys plunged 12% in the intra-day trade on the BSE.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Gold prices jump to 1-month high amid Russia-Ukraine war, inflation concerns
text: Gold prices jumped to more than one-month high on Monday amid concerns over economic fallout from Russia-Ukraine war and surging inflation. Spot gold rose 0.9% to $1,991.51 per ounce. Among other metals, spot silver rose 1% to $25.93 per ounce, whereas Platinum climbed 1.8%. Bullion is considered a safe store of value during times of political and economic crisis.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: What is 'pyramid fraud' that Amway India is accused of running?
text: The ED accused Amway India of running a 'pyramid fraud' and provisionally attached its assets worth ₹757.77 crore. It alleged Amway of running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing network and exorbitant pricing of products. "Gullible public is induced to join as members and purchase products at exorbitant prices, losing their hard-earned money," ED said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World Bank cuts global growth forecast to 3.2% due to Ukraine war
text: World Bank President David Malpass on Monday said the bank has cut its global growth forecast for 2022 from 4.1% to 3.2% owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. Forecasts are being cut for advanced and many developing economies because of spikes in food, energy prices, Malpass said. World Bank is also proposing a new, 15-month crisis financing target of $170 billion.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FM Nirmala Sitharaman to travel to US on official visit tonight
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will embark on an official visit to the United States late tonight, the Ministry of Finance said on Sunday. During her visit, Sitharaman will attend the spring meetings of the IMF and the World Bank and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governor meeting. She will also hold one-on-one meetings with CEOs of various companies.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Rise in private debt due to COVID-19 may affect growth over 3 yrs: IMF
text: A chapter of the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook said debt accumulated by the private sector during the COVID-19 pandemic could lower growth for emerging markets by 1.3% over three years. For developed nations, growth is expected to be reduced by 0.9%. IMF had earlier forecasted advanced and emerging markets to grow at 3.9% and 4.8% in 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Jet fuel price up 0.2%, touches all-time high after 2022's 8th hike
text: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, was hiked by 0.2% on Saturday to an all-time high on the back of rising global oil prices. ATF now costs ₹1,13,202.33/kl in Delhi, ₹1,11,981.99/kl in Mumbai and ₹1,17,753.6/kl in Kolkata. In eight hikes beginning January 1, ATF prices have been increased by ₹39,180.42, or almost 50%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Products of 30,000 small brands cater to 80% of population: Survey
text: A Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) survey showed household products of over 30,000 brands operating at small and medium scale cater to 80% of India's population. Big brands are in demand among people of higher and upper-middle classes, CAIT Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said. "It's a myth that about 3,000 big brands...are catering to the people's needs," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt registered highest-ever 1.67 lakh companies in FY22, up 8% YoY
text: Corporate Affairs Ministry registered over 1.67 lakh companies incorporations in FY22, an 8% YoY increase from 1.55 lakh companies incorporations registered in FY21. This is the highest number of company incorporations in a financial year till date. The Ministry said it has taken many initiatives for reducing the number of procedures, time and cost for starting a business in India.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Investors lose ₹2.5 lakh crore wealth in a day as Sensex crashes 1,170 points
text: Nearly ₹2.5 lakh crore was wiped off investors' wealth on Monday as Sensex plunged 1,172 points to settle at 57,166 amid weak global cues. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies dropped to ₹269.48 lakh crore from ₹ 272.12 lakh crore in the previous session. Infosys, HDFC, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra, Wipro and TCS were among the top losers on Monday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Auto, taxi drivers in Delhi to go on strike tomorrow demanding hike in fares
text: Various unions of auto, taxi and minibus drivers in Delhi will go on strike on Monday demanding a cut in CNG prices and a hike in fares. Sarvodaya Driver Association Delhi, whose members also drive for cab aggregators, said it'll go on an indefinite strike. The Delhi government has said it's setting up a committee to consider revising the fares.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: PVR Chairman Ajay Bijli forms a band in his 50s, releases 1st music video
text: PVR Chairman Ajay Bijli has launched a music video with his band Random Order. He dedicated the song, 'Don't let the sun go down on me', originally sung by Elton John, to the medical community for their service during the COVID-19 pandemic. "The idea was to tell a story," said Bijli, who launched the band in his 50s.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Which Indian crypto exchanges recently disabled UPI and other payment options?
text: Indian crypto exchange CoinSwitch Kuber recently disabled all modes of payments for purchasing crypto on its platform. WazirX and CoinDCX announced that rupee deposits through MobiKwik have been temporarily suspended. While BuyUcoin Co-founder Atulya Bhatt said the platform has halted UPI payments, Mudrex CEO Edul Patel told Bloomberg that Indian payment gateways have started withdrawing support.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ex-Reddit CEO says Musk 'is in for pain if he takes over Twitter'; he replies
text: Former Reddit CEO Yishan Wong in a long Twitter thread said that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "in for a world of pain" if he takes over Twitter. Wong suggested that Musk won't be able to uphold the free speech ideals of the "old internet". Meanwhile, Musk replied to this and said, "Twitter is way overdue for long-form tweets!"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter brings on JPMorgan as adviser amid Musk's acquisition offer: Report
text: Twitter has reportedly brought on JPMorgan Chase & Co. to help it respond to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion acquisition offer. As per a report, the bank recently started working to assist Twitter in talks with potential buyers. Meanwhile, Twitter has adopted a 'poison pill' strategy that prevents Musk from raising his stake in the company.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Don't believe any person or institution should own social media: Dorsey
text: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey while responding to Ethereum's Co-founder Vitalik Buterin on Tesla CEO Elon Musk's acquisition bid for Twitter said he doesn't believe "any individual or institutions should own social media or media firms". Buterin had tweeted, "Don't oppose Elon running Twitter...but I do disagree with the...generalised enthusiasm for wealthy people...takeover social media firms."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: What is the 'poison pill' strategy adopted by Twitter against Musk's takeover offer?
text: Formally known as the shareholder rights plan, it's a defensive strategy used by companies against hostile takeovers. At Twitter, the plan will be triggered if any entity buys at least 15% of its stock in a purchase that isn't approved by its board. Following this, the entity's stake will be diluted as other shareholders will be offered discounted shares.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter board may be concerned about other bidders: Musk on 'poison pill' move
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the Twitter board might have adopted the shareholder rights plan, or 'poison pill', out of concern about "other potential bidders" than just him. Musk was replying to a tweet saying the board has rejected Musk's offer to buy Twitter "20% above market value" by adopting the defensive strategy and also "threatened" to dilute shareholders' stake.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk considering bringing in partners on his Twitter takeover offer: Report
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is speaking to investors who could partner with him on his Twitter acquisition offer, a report said. It said that Musk might be partnering with Silver Lake Partners, a private equity firm that was a potential investor when he considered taking Tesla private in 2018. Silver Lake's Co-CEO Egon Durban is already a Twitter board member.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter board’s interest not aligned with shareholders: Musk in reply to a tweet
text: Responding to a tweet amid his $43 billion takeover offer, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that the economic interests of the Twitter board are "simply not aligned with shareholders". Musk was replying to a tweet about board members' stock holdings. The Tesla CEO also said, "Wow, with Jack (Dorsey) departing, the Twitter board collectively owns almost no shares!"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I didn't have a sort of happy childhood, it was rough: Elon Musk
text: The world’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk while talking about how his childhood shaped his business sensibility said, he "didn’t have a sort of happy childhood". Musk added, "It was quite, quite rough, but I read a lot of books." Speaking about his Asperger's syndrome, he said that might have helped him drive to build Tesla and SpaceX.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Indeed: Musk on tweet saying 'If the game is fair, Elon will buy Twitter'
text: Elon Musk, who has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion, responded "Indeed" to a tweet that read, "If the game is fair, Elon will buy Twitter." The tweet further said, "If the game is rigged, there will be some reason why he won't be able to." It added, "We're about to find out how deep the corruption goes."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tek Travels DMCC acquires 51% stake in Switzerland-based BookaBed AG
text: Tek Travels DMCC, which is a wholly owned subsidiary of TBO Tek Limited, has announced that it has acquired 51% shareholding of Switzerland-based B2B accommodation provider BookaBed AG. "We are excited to welcome everyone at BookaBed to the TBO family. BookaBed allows TBO's entry into the Irish market and strengthens our UK presence," TBO Co-Founder Gaurav Bhatnagar said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Zomato defers new food quality policy after criticism by restaurants: Report
text: Zomato has deferred the implementation of its new food quality policy to May 3 from April 18 after criticism by restaurants, reports said. Under the policy called 'Severe Food Quality' rules, Zomato proposed it would temporarily ban restaurants if consumers complained about their food quality. Zomato has deferred the policy and sought feedback from restaurant partners on the new policy.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: GST Council may do away with 5% slab; move items to 3% & 8% rates: Reports
text: The GST Council in its next meeting is likely to consider a proposal to do away with the 5% slab by moving goods to 3% and the 8% categories, as per sources. It is also said that discussions are on to raise the 5% slab to either 7 or 8 or 9%. Gold and gold jewellery attract a 3% tax.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I agree: Anand Mahindra on tweet calling 10-min grocery deliveries 'inhuman'
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Sunday tweeted, "I agree" while sharing a tweet by Pramesh CS, Director of Tata Memorial Hospital, that called 10-minute grocery deliveries "inhuman" for the delivery agents. Pramesh had tweeted, "I don't care how many trolls I get with this tweet...Customers can live with a two or even a six-hour delivery time."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Cosmetics chain L'Occitane pulls out of Russia days after defending to stay open
text: French cosmetics chain L'Occitane has decided to shut its Russian operations, days after defending its decision to stay open. The company said that its decision followed the "enormous human suffering" in Ukraine. Last week, the brand said that it won’t close its stores in Russia as its staff might face retaliation as a result of the potential exit.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Ukraine's richest man Rinat Akhmetov vows to rebuild Mariupol post-war
text: Ukraine's richest man Rinat Akhmetov has pledged to rebuild Mariupol where his mining and steel company Metinvest is based. He added, "My ambition is to return to a Ukrainian Mariupol and implement our (new production) plans so that Mariupol-produced steel can compete in global markets as before." According to Forbes magazine, Akhmetov's net worth currently stands at $3.9 billion.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Just 1 or 2 days in office ideal for hybrid work: Harvard Business School study
text: Just one or two days in the office is the ideal setup for hybrid work, according to a paper from Harvard Business School. "Intermediate hybrid work is plausibly the sweet spot...where workers enjoy flexibility and yet aren't as isolated compared to peers who are predominantly working from home," it said. "Hybrid work is associated with improved worker outcomes," it added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private ruled 'false' by US judge, claim investors
text: Tesla investors have alleged that a federal judge on April 1 ruled that CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets about having secured financing to take the company private were "false and misleading”. In a court filing, the investors who are suing Musk over his tweets, added that Musk "used his fame and notoriety to sway public opinion in his favour."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt amends FEMA rules to allow up to 20% FDI in IPO-bound LIC
text: The government has amended the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) to allow up to 20% foreign direct investment (FDI) in state-run LIC through the automatic route. "Foreign investment in LIC shall be subject to the provisions of...Life Insurance Corporation Act, 1956," a gazette notification said. The development comes ahead of LIC's IPO, expected to be India's biggest-ever public issue.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sri Lankan stock exchange to halt trading for 5 days amid crisis
text: The Colombo Stock Exchange will remain shut for five business days from April 18, according to the Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka. The move is aimed at providing investors an opportunity to have "more clarity and understanding" of the current economic conditions, it said. Sri Lanka is dealing with its worst economic crisis since its independence in 1948.
author: Shailesh

headlines: M&M to sell stake in Mahindra Sanyo Special Steel in ₹212-cr deal
text: Automotive manufacturer Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) has announced that it will sell its stake of over 34.75 lakh shares in Mahindra Sanyo Special Steel Pvt Ltd (MSSSPL) to Japan-based Sanyo Special Steel. M&M declared in a regulatory filing that post the ₹212 crore deal, its holding in MSSSPL will be nil. Turnover of MSSSPL was ₹834.43 crore as of FY21.
author: Shambhavi Mehrotra

headlines: FPIs turn net sellers again, withdraw ₹4,500 cr between Apr 8-15
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) turned net sellers again after withdrawing ₹4,500 crore between April 8-15. FPIs had been net sellers for six months between October 2021 and March 2022 and had turned net buyers between April 1-8 with an investment of ₹7,707 crore. Apart from equities, FPIs withdrew net ₹415 crore from the debt markets last week.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ICICI Prudential Life reports 2-fold jump in net profit in Jan-Mar
text: ICICI Prudential Life Insurance recorded a Q1 net profit of ₹185 crore, driven by steady growth in new business. Its value for new business for FY2022 at ₹2,163 crore is up 33.4% from FY2021. "In March, we posted the best-ever monthly sales by the company in any year since inception," said NS Kannan, MD & CEO, ICICI Prudential Life.
author: Shambhavi Mehrotra

headlines: HDFC Bank year-on-year profit up by 24% in Q1
text: Keeping in line with analysts' expectations, India's largest private sector lender HDFC Bank has reported a jump of 24% year-on-year (Y-O-Y) in its consolidated net profit for the Jan-March, 2022 quarter. The lender's gross non-performing assets were at 1.17% of its gross advances, as compared to 1.32% last year. Its consolidated net profit is at ₹10,474 crore.
author: Shambhavi Mehrotra

headlines: Campus Activewear IPO expected to be launched in May: Reports
text: Campus Activewear's IPO is expected to be launched in May 2022, according to reports. The company plans to sell 5.1 crore shares that'll be offered for sale by promoters and investors. The money raised will go to shareholders and Campus won't receive any of the funds. It had received market regulator SEBI's nod for the IPO launch in March.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Vanguard Group replaces Musk as Twitter's largest shareholder with 10.3% stake
text: Days after Tesla CEO Elon Musk disclosed being the largest shareholder at Twitter with a 9.2% stake, the position has now been taken by US' Vanguard Group. In its recent publicly available filings with the US Securities and Exchange Commission, the company disclosed owning 82.4 million shares of Twitter, which means 10.3%. Vanguard's holdings are reportedly worth $3.78 billion now.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter adopts 'poison pill' rights plan to block Musk's $43 billion takeover bid
text: Twitter is adopting a limited duration shareholder rights plan, often called a 'poison pill', after the world's richest man Elon Musk offered to buy the company for $43 billion. Under this plan, if any person or group acquires at least 15% of Twitter's stock without the board's approval, other shareholders will be allowed to purchase additional shares at a discount.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Not sure if I'll be able to acquire Twitter, have a Plan B too: Musk
text: After making an offer to acquire Twitter, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said he wasn’t sure if he'll be "actually able to acquire it." Speaking at a TED event, Musk also said he has a Plan B if Twitter rejected his offer. He said his offer was to create "an inclusive arena for free speech" and not to make money.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: US-based Thoma Bravo contacts Twitter with acquisition offer: Report
text: US-based private equity firm Thoma Bravo has contacted Twitter and is putting together an acquisition offer that could rival Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid, as per a report. While it isn't yet clear as to how much Thoma Bravo will offer, a source said that the company could be a white knight for Twitter and CEO Parag Agrawal.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Utterly indefensible to not put this offer to vote: Musk on his Twitter bid
text: Replying to a user on Twitter possibly rejecting his offer, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "It would be utterly indefensible not to put this offer to a shareholder vote. They own the company, not the board of directors." The user had tweeted, "If the board of directors...reject the offer...wouldn't it be acting in...opposition to the financial interests of their shareholders?"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Saudi prince, a major Twitter shareholder, rejects Musk's offer; he replies
text: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal Al Saud, a billionaire and one of Twitter's largest shareholders, rejected Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter saying his offer isn't close to the company's "intrinsic value". Meanwhile, Musk replied, "Just two questions...How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own, directly & indirectly? What are the Kingdom's views on journalistic freedom of speech?"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk's Twitter bid probably not good for me: Teenager who tracked his jet
text: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old who tracked Elon Musk's private jet, reacted to Musk's Twitter offer, saying, "Oh no. Probably good for Twitter but probably not me lol." "I mean if he really wanted to then he could shut me down," Sweeney told Business Insider. Earlier, Sweeney asked TED Head Chris Anderson to ask Musk what made him buy Twitter stock.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Major tech firms calling lawyers asking if they can buy Twitter: Cuban
text: Reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter for $43 billion, US billionaire investor Mark Cuban took to Twitter. Cuban tweeted, "Every major tech company, Google, FB, et al is on the phone with their antitrust lawyers asking if they can buy Twitter...Twitter is on the phone with their lawyers asking which can be their white knight."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter weighs 'poison pill' strategy to prevent Musk from raising stake: Report
text: Twitter's board is considering adopting a 'poison pill' strategy to prevent Elon Musk from raising his stake in the company significantly, Bloomberg reported. The strategy allows existing shareholders to buy more shares at a discount, effectively diluting the hostile party's stake. In a TED interview, Musk said "there's a plan B" if Twitter rejects his offer to buy the company.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk offered to buy my firm too: Journalist while sharing his experience
text: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered to acquire Twitter, journalist Conrad Quilty-Harper spoke about the time when Musk offered to buy the science magazine he worked for in 2019. While Musk didn’t acquire the company, Conrad shared aspects such as trusting your social media manager, auditing the Twitter following and interaction with Musk, etc, as the takeaways from the incident.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Elon Musk can buy Sri Lanka, call himself Ceylon Musk: Snapdeal CEO shares viral text
text: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl took to Twitter to share a viral WhatsApp forward after Elon Musk offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion. "He can buy [Sri Lanka's debt] and call himself Ceylon Musk," Bahl said. Sri Lanka is facing its worst economic crisis since the 1940s and recently declared it is defaulting on its $51 billion external debt.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Those b*******: Musk on SEC over his 2018 Tesla tweets settlement
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk while discussing his SEC settlement over his 2018 Tesla tweets said, "I was forced to concede to the SEC unlawfully. Those b*******." He added he was forced to settle as banks threatened to cease providing capital and Tesla could have gone bankrupt. "I was forced to admit that I lied to save Tesla's life," Musk said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Musk asks Twitter users if taking Twitter private should be up to shareholders
text: World's richest man Elon Musk has started a poll on Twitter asking users whether the decision to take Twitter private should be up to the company's shareholders. "Taking Twitter private at $54.20 should be up to shareholders, not the board," the poll reads. Musk has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion, saying it is his "best and final offer".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: What did Elon Musk say when asked why he wanted to acquire Twitter?
text: Speaking at a TED event, the world’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk while answering a query on why he wanted to acquire Twitter said it was important for "there to be an arena for free speech". Musk added, "This isn't a way to sort of make money...Having a public platform that is maximally trusted and broadly inclusive, is...important."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Air India starts restoring salaries, allowances to pre-pandemic levels
text:
With the aviation sector recovering due to the decline in COVID-19 cases, Air India is restoring salaries and various other allowances of its employees in a phased manner to pre-pandemic levels. 
As per Air India’s document, for the cabin crew and pilots, the flying allowance, special pay and wide-body allowance will be restored to pre-pandemic levels starting April 1.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Egypt has approved India as wheat supplier: Piyush Goyal
text: World's top wheat importer Egypt has approved India as a wheat supplier, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced on Friday. The development comes amid a sharp decline in availability of wheat in global markets due to the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, who are both major wheat exporters. Egypt is looking to import 1 million tonne of wheat from India.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Germany seizes world's largest superyacht 'Dilbar' owned by Russian oligarch
text: The world's largest superyacht, 'Dilbar', owned by Russian oligarch Alisher Usmanov, has been officially seized by Germany as part of its sanctions against Moscow over the invasion of Ukraine. With two helipads and the largest indoor pool ever installed on a yacht, 'Dilbar' is worth $600 million and it costs $60 million per year to maintain it.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Senco Gold files draft papers for ₹525 crore IPO
text: Jewellery retailer Senco Gold and Diamonds has filed draft papers with the SEBI to raise ₹525 crore through an IPO. The offer comprises fresh issue of equity shares of up to ₹325 crore and an offer for sale of shares worth ₹200 crore. Senco plans to use net proceeds from IPO towards funding working capital requirements and general corporate purposes.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: My conclusion, Musk is f****** with SEC: Cuban on his Twitter bid
text: US billionaire investor Mark Cuban while discussing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's Twitter bid, said, "My conclusion, Elon Musk is f****** with...SEC." "His filing with the SEC allows him to say he wants to take a company private for $54.20," Cuban wrote, comparing the bid to Musk's tweet about taking Tesla private at $420 that landed him in trouble with SEC.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Elon Musk is winning against GM, Ford, Toyota: Warren Buffett
text: Berkshire Hathaway Chairman Warren Buffett in an interview with Charlie Rose said Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "winning" against his competitors like GM, Ford and Toyota. He said all the firms against Musk have "got all the stuff" and Musk has "got an idea". "And he's winning. That's America. You can't dream it up. It's astounding," Buffett added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Elon is distracted, he's got a lot going on: Tesla investor exec
text: Amid the ongoing news surrounding Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion offer to buy Twitter, Tesla investor Loup Ventures Managing Partner Gene Munster said, "Elon is distracted. He's got a lot of things going on. He's involved in a lot of different endeavours." "This is a one to three months headwind to Tesla's stock," he added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Will be interesting to see how Musk's Twitter offer evolves: Amazon CEO
text: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in an interview discussing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to buy Twitter said the news is "very interesting", adding, "We all use Twitter...to some degree...It'll be interesting to see how it evolves." On being asked if Musk is ultimately going to buy Twitter, Jassy said, "I don't know. That's, that's the rumour."
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Must be careful of EV push, it raises dependency on few nations: BMW
text: BMW CEO Oliver Zipse warned firms of the EV push, adding there was still a market for combustion engine cars. "When you look at the technology coming out, the EV push, we must be careful because at the same time, you increase dependency on very few countries," Zipse said. He highlighted that China mostly controls battery raw materials' supply.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Delhi govt to form panel to consider revision of auto & taxi fares
text: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot has announced the formation of a committee to consider the revision of auto and taxi fares. Earlier, auto, taxi and cab drivers' associations warned the authorities to go on a strike from Monday if their demand for subsidy on gas prices wasn't met. Notably, CNG price was hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi yesterday.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: SBI to hire business consultant for prospects in EV space
text: India's largest public sector lender SBI has decided to hire a consultant to explore business opportunities for digital payments in the electric vehicle (EV) charging segment. The consultant will need to identify market potential, develop a strategic roadmap and provide recommendations on the next steps and areas for support through investments, said SBI in a request for proposal (RFP) document.
author: Shambhavi Mehrotra

headlines: N Chandrasekaran implements management reshuffle at Air India
text: After the recent acquisition of Air India by Tata Group, Air India and Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has conducted a major reshuffle in the airline's senior management. Veteran Meenakshi Mallik has been replaced by Nipun Aggarwal as the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) and Suresh Dutt Tripathi will succeed Air India's Amrita Sharan as the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO).
author: Shambhavi Mehrotra

headlines: Elon Musk offers to buy Twitter for $43 billion
text: Tesla CEO and the world's richest man, Elon Musk, has offered to buy micro-blogging platform Twitter for $43 billion, Bloomberg reported on Thursday. Musk's offer price of $54.20 per share represents a 38% premium to the closing price of Twitter's stock on April 1, Reuters said. Musk, with an over 9% Twitter stake, is the platform's biggest shareholder.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: We have no work with any Russian client today: Infosys
text: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh, while announcing Infosys Q4 results, said, "We have no work with any Russian client today and we have no plans for any work with any Russian client going ahead." He added, "The work we do is for a few of our global clients that have operations in Russia. We have less than 100 employees in Russia."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: My best and final offer: Musk on $43 billion offer to buy Twitter
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk, in a letter to Twitter's Chairman Bret Taylor, called his offer to buy Twitter for $43 billion his "best and final offer". Musk, who's currently the biggest shareholder of Twitter with an over 9% stake, added, "If it is not accepted, I would need to reconsider my position as a shareholder."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: This is not a threat: Elon Musk in his offer to buy Twitter
text: Elon Musk, in his offer to buy Twitter, said, "If the deal...doesn't work...given that I don't have confidence in management nor do I believe I can drive necessary change in public market...I'd need to reconsider my position as a shareholder." He added, "This isn't a threat, it's simply not a good investment without the changes that need to be made."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Infosys has a three-phase plan for employees' return to offices: CFO
text: Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy explained employees' three-phased return to work plan, saying, "In the first phase, we're encouraging people in their home locations...in the DCs (Development Centres) where they are...to come at least twice a week." He said, "Phase two is encouraging people outside DC towns to make preparations for return." He called "looking at hybrid work" the third phase.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Infosys hired 85,000 freshers last year, to add over 50,000 freshers this year
text: Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy said, "In the last year (FY22) we hired 85,000 freshers, both globally and in India." He added, "We are planning to do (hire) upwards of 50,000 freshers at least this year (FY23)...and we will see how that plays out...but that's just initial." He also said, "The good news is...we've mastered the art of off-campus recruitment."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter not held hostage by Musk's offer, CEO Parag tells staff: Report
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, while reassuring the staff, said that they weren't being "held hostage" by the news of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to buy the company, a source told Reuters. Agrawal also encouraged employees to remain focused and said that "we as employees control what happens". On Thursday, Musk offered to acquire Twitter for $43 billion.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter has extraordinary potential, I'll unlock it: Musk on offer to buy Twitter
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion, in a letter to Twitter's Chairman Bret Taylor said, "Twitter has extraordinary potential. I will unlock it." Musk, Twitter's biggest shareholder, added, "Since making my investment (in Twitter) I now realise the company will neither thrive nor serve this societal imperative in its current form."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I don't have confidence in management: Musk to Twitter Chairman
text: World's richest person Elon Musk said he doesn't have confidence in management while offering to buy Twitter for $43 billion, a regulatory filing revealed. "I am not playing the back-and-forth game...It's a high price and your shareholders will love it," Musk told Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor. Musk added, "I have decided I want to acquire Twitter and take it private."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I once told Ratan Tata that RSS doesn't discriminate on religion: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "I once told industrialist Ratan Tata that RSS doesn't discriminate on religion." Gadkari said that years ago, he had approached Tata for the inauguration of a hospital named after an RSS leader. Gadkari added, "Tata asked if the hospital was only for Hindus as it belongs to RSS...I told him discrimination doesn't happen in RSS."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Import of cotton fully exempted from customs duties till September 30
text: The government has exempted all cotton imports from customs duties from April 14 to September 30, 2022. Currently, cotton imports attract 5% Basic Customs Duty (BCD) and 5% Agriculture Infrastructure Development Cess (AIDC). "This exemption shall benefit the textile chain - yarn, fabric, garments, and provide relief to consumers," the Finance Ministry said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Adani Green Energy becomes India's 8th most valuable company
text: Adani Green Energy has jumped two spots to become India's eighth most valued firm with a market valuation of ₹4.48 lakh crore. The company, which entered the list of top-10 valued firms on Monday, overtook Bajaj Finance and HDFC Ltd on Wednesday. Reliance Industries is India's most valued firm, followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, Infosys, ICICI Bank, HUL and SBI.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: INOX Group's Siddharth Jain buys quadruplex for ₹144 crore in Mumbai: Report
text: Siddharth Jain, Executive Director of INOX Group which has businesses including industrial gases and entertainment, bought a quadruplex flat in Mumbai's Worli for ₹144 crore, according to documents accessed by IndexTap. It's an amalgamation of flats on 42nd, 43rd, 44th and 46th floors in Raheja Legend. The agreement value is ₹144 crore and the stamp duty paid is ₹7.2 crore.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: NPCI approves additional 6 crore UPI users for WhatsApp
text: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has approved an additional 6 crore users on UPI for WhatsApp. With this approval, WhatsApp will be able to expand the service to 10 crore users. The move comes months after NPCI approved increasing the user cap for WhatsApp's payment service from 2 crore to 4 crore.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: We will review 'unsolicited' offer from Elon Musk: Twitter
text: Twitter's board will review an "unsolicited, non-binding" offer from Tesla CEO Elon Musk to acquire the social media company, Twitter said on Thursday. With a stake of over 9% in Twitter, Musk has offered to buy the remaining shares at a price of $54.2/share. We will determine the course of action that's in the best interest of shareholders, Twitter added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: US firm's stock more than triples after fake release said Tesla acquired it
text: The shares of US-based Lithium Corp more than tripled on Wednesday after a fake press release claimed Tesla had acquired it. The shares were trading up about 25% at 1:16 pm, while Tesla shares rose 3.1% to $1,017.19. Lithium Corp issued a press release stating that it had not received "so much as an expression of interest from Tesla".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Emirates airline to launch NFTs for employees, customers
text: Emirates has announced that it will soon launch NFTs and "exciting experiences" in the metaverse for its customers and employees. It said that the first projects are already underway, with a launch anticipated in the coming months. Emirates' NFTs are going to be both collectible and utility-based, a statement from the firm said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: China's anti-corruption watchdog involved in Jack Ma's Ant probe: Report
text: China's anti-corruption watchdog CCDI was among the agencies involved in a recent inquiry into links between billionaire Jack Ma's Ant and state-owned Chinese companies, Bloomberg News reported. It sought to understand Ant's influence and the extent of its transactions with state banks and enterprises. It was also involved in questions sent to state firms about their exposure to Ant.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Firms must recall batches of EVs that caught fire: NITI Aayog CEO
text: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Wednesday said original equipment manufacturers should voluntarily recall batches of electric vehicles (EVs) involved in the recent fire accidents. Kant said the move will help in creating a sense of confidence among consumers. Adding that every transition has had its own challenges, Kant said "there's nothing to panic about" regarding the safety of EVs.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rising tax revenue keeps us on track to becoming $5 tn economy: Govt
text: The Finance Ministry on Thursday said the government's focus on capital expenditure will boost manufacturing and tax revenue collections, thereby keeping India on track to becoming a $5 trillion economy. Tax revenues in FY22 witnessed a 33.5% rise to ₹27.07 lakh crore. The Ministry added that the government has managed to keep nominal GDP growth above 10% in recent years.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BlackRock, Mubadala to invest ₹4,000 cr in Tata Power Renewables
text: A BlackRock Real Assets-led consortium, including Mubadala Investment Company, has decided to invest ₹4,000 crore in Tata Power Renewable Energy Limited. BlackRock, together with Mubadala, shall invest by way of equity/compulsorily convertible instruments for a 10.53% stake in the renewable energy arm of Tata Power. This will translate to a base equity valuation of ₹34,000 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CBI books textiles major S Kumars in ₹1,245 crore loan fraud case
text: CBI has booked textiles major S Kumars Nationwide Limited and 14 others, including its promoters and directors, for an alleged bank fraud worth ₹1,245 crore. CBI had on Wednesday searched 13 locations related to the accused and recovered "incriminating documents", CBI spokesperson RC Joshi said. He added that promoters and directors allegedly misused bank consortium's funds between 2012 and 2018.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Alliance Air no longer a subsidiary of Tata Group's Air India
text: Air India on Thursday announced that Alliance Air is no longer its subsidiary. "Passengers holding tickets of Air India with a four-digit flight number starting with '9' or a three-digit flight number starting with '9I' may please be informed that these bookings belong to Alliance Air," Air India said. It added it won't handle Alliance Air-related queries from April 15.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: World Bank slashes India's FY23 GDP forecast from 8.7% to 8%
text: The World Bank cut its FY23 GDP growth forecast for India from 8.7% to 8%. "High oil and food prices caused by the war in Ukraine will have a strong negative impact on people's real incomes," said World Bank South Asia VP Hartwig Schafer. World Bank has also slashed the growth forecast for South Asia, excluding Afghanistan, to 6.6%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Infosys' employee attrition rate rises to 27.7% in Q4
text: Infosys announced on Wednesday that its employee attrition rate continued to rise during the January-March 2022 quarter, reaching 27.7%. The attrition rate in Q3 FY22 was 25.5% and in Q4 FY21 was 10.9%. Infosys' employee count increased 20.95% YoY from 2,59,619 to 3,14,015 in Q4 FY22, with a majority of them being software professionals.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Planning to launch IPO in next 2-3 years: Haldiram's Chairman
text: Haldiram's is expected to enter public markets soon and the launch of its IPO is being planned in the next two-three years, the sweet and snack maker's Chairman Manohar Lal Agarwal said. Speaking on rising inflation in India, Agarwal said the company has managed to hike prices by only 10-20%. "Due to soaring inflation, almost everything is costlier," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bank of India files for insolvency proceedings against Future Retail
text: Bank of India on Thursday filed a petition with the National Company Law Tribunal to initiate insolvency proceedings against Future Retail for non-payment of dues. This comes amid an ongoing legal battle between Future Retail and Amazon over the former's ₹24,713 crore deal with Reliance Industries. "Amazon wanted to destroy us...they've destroyed us," Future Retail had said earlier.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Do it like the rich do: dezerv.
text: Wealthtech firm dezerv. claims to help you invest like the ultra-wealthy have been investing for decades. Their experts aim to curate high-performing portfolios to maximize your wealth. dezerv. also offers its members exclusive access to benefits like pre-IPO deals and plans to offer global equity deals soon. It’s time to use the strategies of the ultra-wealthy for yourself, said dezerv.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Retail inflation rises to 17-month-high of 6.95% in March 2022
text: India's retail inflation jumped to a 17-month-high of 6.95% in March 2022 due to higher food and oil prices, data released by the government on Tuesday showed. This is the third consecutive month in which retail inflation has breached the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) upper margin of 6%. The country's retail inflation stood at 6.01% for February 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Russia's economy set for biggest contraction since 1994: Report
text: Russia's economy is on track to contract by over 10% in 2022, said Alexei Kudrin, who served as Russia's Finance Minister from 2000 to 2011. A contraction of 10% would be the biggest decline in GDP since 1994, according to World Bank and IMF data, Reuters reported. World Bank this month forecast Russian GDP output would fall 11.2% this year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 'Made in India' COVID-19 vaccines better than Pfizer, Moderna: Adar Poonawalla
text: Covishield maker Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla claimed that "Made in India" COVID-19 vaccines have provided better protection than mRNA vaccines like Pfizer and Moderna. "It's good that...vaccines like...Pfizer and Moderna aren't introduced in India," he said. "In countries like the US, people have taken 2nd and 3rd booster dose and still many are getting infected," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Google CEO Pichai to co-chair council to help Ukrainian refugees settle in US
text: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai will co-chair a new CEO council with over 30 CEOs to help Ukrainians and Afghans resettle in the US. "It builds on Google's long-standing support for immigrants, dreamers and refugees, and will help people through access to technology, jobs and more," Pichai said. The Welcome.US CEO council is co-chaired by Accenture CEO Julie Sweet.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: What an incredible answer: Paytm CEO on MEA Jaishankar's remark on Russia
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to laud the MEA S Jaishankar for his response to a reporter, who had asked, "Why not condemn Russia's invasion (of Ukraine)?" Jaishankar responded, "I prefer to do it my way and articulate it my way...We've made statements...We're against the conflict." Sharing Jaishankar's response, the Paytm CEO tweeted, "What an incredible answer."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Meta spent $26.8 million on CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021
text: Meta spent $26.8 million on its CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021, regulatory filings revealed. Meta said, "He is synonymous with Meta and, as a result, negative sentiment regarding our company is directly associated with, and often transferred to, Zuckerberg." The 37-year-old billionaire took home a base salary of $1 last year and doesn't receive a bonus or equity awards.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk sued by Twitter investor over delay in disclosing Twitter stake
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has been sued by a Twitter investor who claims Musk's delay in disclosing his ownership of over 5% of Twitter artificially kept its share price down. The delay allowed Musk to buy more shares at a lower price, the suit alleges. Musk was required to disclose his then 5% stake by March 24.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Wake-up call for industry to get its act together: Hero Electric MD on EV fires
text: Hero Electric MD Naveen Munjal told Moneycontrol the recent incidents of e-scooters catching fire are a wake-up call for the industry to get its act together. He said that issues with electric vehicles (EVs) have to be addressed by proper testing and due diligence. "You can't shortcut a lot of these things, which could lead to dangerous territory," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I really liked it: PM Modi on graph with sound of money transacted via UPI
text: India in Pixels shared a graph with the sound of money transacted via UPI from October 2016 to March 2022 through data sonification on Twitter. PM Narendra Modi said, "I've spoken about UPI and Digital Payments quite often but I really liked how you've used the sound of money transacted...to effectively convey the point. Very interesting, impressive and obviously informative!"
author: Apaar Sharma
