When asked about the next milestone, Jagdishan said, "We don't work for any milestones." He added, "Even if I'm not there...this engine created by the founding fathers...it's such a fantastic platform that it will grow on its own."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Investors get ₹4.5 lakh crore richer as Sensex rallies over HDFC merger
text: Investors turned richer by over ₹4.5 lakh crore on Monday as Sensex ended 1,335 points higher at 60,612, primarily led by the merger announcement of HDFC and HDFC Bank. Data showed that investor wealth, measured by the combined market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies, rose to around ₹272.46 lakh crore. Investors of HDFC group companies gained over 1 lakh crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Musk is sending strong signal to Twitter CEO Agrawal: Cathie Wood
text: ARK Invest's Cathie Wood said that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "sending a strong signal" to the new Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, after Musk's 9.2% Twitter stake was revealed. She added Musk is making a statement about censorship and that Musk doesn't believe in it. Wood also discussed that the news could also be "setting up for another leadership change".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Amazon, Future Retail agree in Supreme Court to appear before SIAC
text: Amazon and Future Retail (FRL) expressed their agreement before the Supreme Court on Monday to appear before the Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) over FRL's deal with Reliance Retail. Amazon and FRL are involved in legal fight over FRL's ₹24,713-crore deal with Reliance. The Supreme Court told the companies that it will request the arbitration tribunal to expedite the proceedings.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IndiGo suspends few pilots, they reportedly planned protest over pay cuts
text: Some IndiGo pilots were suspended for planning a mass leave on Tuesday to protest against pay cuts, reports said. IndiGo pilots' salaries were cut by as much as 30% during the COVID-19 pandemic's peak. "We confirm that a handful of IndiGo pilots have been suspended...for indulging in activities that are in contravention to the terms of their employment," IndiGo said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Petrol prices reach ₹110.25/litre in B'luru as fuel rates hiked again
text: Fuel prices were hiked again across the country for the 13th time in 15 days on Tuesday. Following the latest price revision, the price of petrol has reached ₹110.25 per litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹94.01 per litre. Meanwhile, Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission has hiked electricity tariffs by five paise per unit across the state.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Hyd civic body launches scheme offering 5% rebate on property tax
text: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation has launched an early bird scheme through which people can avail a 5% rebate on property tax. Municipal Administration Department's Director N Satyanarayana said the scheme will apply to those who pay property tax by April 30. Reportedly, GHMC received ₹13.9 crore in two days from 34,540 people who paid property taxes online through the scheme.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: We must have a common culture post-merger: HDFC Chairman
text: HDFC and HDFC Bank "will have to have a common culture" after the merger, HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said on Tuesday. "Now, bank will have to deal in housing loans which is very emotional, personal...So we have to be very careful with all our customers," he added. As per the announcement, HDFC will acquire a 41% stake in HDFC Bank.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's trade deficit rises by 87.5% to $192 billion in 2021-22
text: India's trade deficit rose by 87.5% from $102.63 billion in 2020-21 to $192.41 billion in 2021-22, government data showed on Monday. While total exports in FY22 rose to a record high of $417.81 billion, imports too soared 54.71% year-on-year to $610.22 billion on the back of rising global fuel and commodity prices. Merchandise imports in FY21 stood at $394.44 billion.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Will protect interest of Supertech twin towers' homebuyers: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Monday said it will protect the interest of homebuyers of Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in its Emerald Court project. The Supreme Court noted submissions of senior advocate S Ganesh, appearing for Supertech's ex-management, that of the 711 homebuyers, claims of 652 homebuyers had been settled. The remaining homebuyers need to be refunded ₹14.96 crore in total.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Banks force you to travel to the home branch for everything: Jupiter
text: People face a lot of trouble due to the rules of some banks, said Jupiter, a 100%* digital banking app, adding that people have to take leaves from work or they end up wasting their weekend just doing bank work. Tired of such routines, Jupiter promises to be a banking partner for millennials and offers a 100%* digital banking experience.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: CNG price hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi, to now cost ₹64.11 per kg
text: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg from Monday. CNG will now cost ₹64.11 per kg in the national capital. "In view of the CNG price hike, we are not in favour of switching on the cab's air conditioner for passengers," a city-based cab driver told ANI.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: HDFC board approves merger of company with HDFC Bank
text: The board of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) has approved the merger of the firm with HDFC Bank. Following the merger, HDFC Bank will be 100% owned by public shareholders and existing shareholders of HDFC Limited will own 41% of HDFC Bank. "[It]...shall enable HDFC Bank to build its housing loan portfolio and enhance its existing customer base," HDFC said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Elon Musk discloses 9.2% stake in Twitter
text: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk has disclosed a passive stake of 9.2% in Twitter, Bloomberg reported citing a US Securities and Exchange Commission filing. Following the news, shares of the social media platform jumped more than 25% in pre-market trading in the US. Musk's stake is worth around $2.89 billion, based on Twitter's closing price on Friday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 12th time in 14 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 12th time in 14 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹103.81/litre after being increased by 40 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹95.07/litre from ₹94.67/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹118.83/litre from ₹118.41/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹103.07/litre from ₹102.64/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: HDFC Bank-HDFC merger may create India's 2nd-largest company, beating TCS
text: HDFC and HDFC Bank saw their combined market capitalisation surpass that of India's second-most valued company, TCS, on Monday. Following the announcement that HDFC will merge itself with HDFC Bank, both stocks surged over 9% each during intraday trade. At closing, HDFC Bank's market value stood at ₹9.18 lakh crore, while HDFC's market cap was at ₹4.84 lakh crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk becomes Twitter's largest shareholder with 9.2% stake
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has become the largest shareholder of Twitter after he disclosed that he owns a 9.2% passive stake in the platform. It's more than quadruple the 2.25% stake held by Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey. Notably, Musk conducted a Twitter poll last month asking users whether Twitter adheres to the principle of free speech.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 30-yr-old crypto billionaire drives Corolla, sleeps on bean bag & has 10 roommates
text: Sam Bankman-Fried, the 30-year-old CEO of the world's third-largest crypto exchange FTX, "lives like a college student", sleeps on a bean bag and drives a Toyota Corolla, Bloomberg reported. "When he's not at the office, he crashes at an apartment with 10 roommates, though it's a penthouse," Bloomberg added. Sam, worth over $20 billion, is currently living in the Bahamas.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bezos shares pic of Amazon's office from early days, says 'Big things start small'
text: The world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos on Sunday took to Instagram to share a picture of his office from Amazon's early days, and wrote, "Big things start small." The office had 'amazon.com' spray-painted on a banner and a table built out of a wooden door. He also shared a video of his company Blue Origin's fourth spaceflight with astronauts aboard.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: $71 billion wiped out of market cap of Singapore's Grab and Sea in 3 months
text: Singapore's two largest new-economy companies have lost a combined $71 billion from their market capitalisation this year. While shares of ride-hailing company Grab have more than halved in the last three months, technology giant Sea's stock price has plunged by 46%. Sea-owned Shopee recently shut down India operations, whereas its Free Fire game was banned by the Indian government.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I'll keep only 1% of my earnings: FTX's 30-yr-old crypto billionaire worth $20 bn
text: Sam Bankman-Fried, the 30-year-old CEO of the world's third-largest crypto exchange FTX, told Bloomberg that he'll "keep enough money to maintain a comfortable life: 1% of his earnings or, at minimum, $100,000 a year." Bloomberg added, "Other than that, he plans to give it all away—every dollar, or Bitcoin." Sam Bankman-Fried has a net worth of over $20 billion.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Rahul shares chart comparing cost of full tank of fuel in vehicles in 2014 & now
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has shared a chart comparing the cost of a full tank of fuel in different vehicles in 2014 and now. According to him, it costed ₹714 for a full tank of fuel in a bike, compared to ₹1,038 now. It costed ₹2,856 for a full tank of fuel in car in 2014, compared to ₹4,152 now.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Shein's valuation would top H&M and Zara combined with $1 billion funding
text: Chinese fashion e-commerce startup Shein is in talks to raise $1 billion and could do so at a valuation that would be more than the combined worth of H&M and Zara. Shein is seeking a valuation of about $100 billion, Bloomberg reported. Following the funding, Shein would become the world’s most-valuable startup after ByteDance and SpaceX, as per CB Insights.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: COVID-19 medicines sold at 5% GST, others at 5-12%: MoS Finance
text: Pankaj Chaudhary, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Finance, on Monday said that COVID-19 medicines and instruments are being sold at a GST rate of 5%. Other medicines have been sold at a GST rate between 5-12% since the pandemic started, he added. He said the GST rate for health insurance is 18%, which is as per international standards.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Economic crisis makes Sri Lankan stocks world's worst performers after Russia
text: Amid Sri Lanka's worst economic crisis, the country's stocks have fallen about 33% in 2022, making them the world's worst performers after Russian equities. In 2021, the Sri Lanka Colombo Stock Exchange had rallied 80%, posting the world's best performance after Mongolia. On Monday, the central bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal resigned amid soaring inflation and fuel shortage.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: FIIs & FPIs may come and go, retail investors take care of markets: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said that retail investors have brought a shock-absorbing capacity into the Indian markets. "FIIs and FPIs may come and go but today the Indian retail investors have proven that any shock that may come in is now taken care of," she added. Sitharaman further informed Lok Sabha that the inflow of FDI remains unabated.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: As son grows older, he acquires father's business: Parekh on HDFC-HDFC Bank merger
text: After HDFC announced that it'll merge itself with HDFC Bank, its Chairman Deepak Parekh said, "It's a merger of equals. It's a friendly...not at all hostile. And, we are one." "As the son grows old, he acquires the father's business...That's all happening here, nothing more," Parekh added. HDFC was founded in 1977, while HDFC Bank was set up in 1994.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex ends 1,335 points higher at 60,612, HDFC & HDFC Bank gain 9% each
text: The Sensex jumped 1,335 points to end at 60,612 on Monday, while the broader Nifty 50 surged 383 points to end at 18,053. HDFC and HDFC Bank, which surged over 9% each following their merger announcement, were the top Sensex gainers. With Sensex reclaiming 60,000-mark on Monday, investors' wealth has increased by ₹30 lakh crore in nearly a month.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I spent two sleepless nights ahead of HDFC-HDFC Bank merger: Chairman
text: After announcing the merger of HDFC with HDFC Bank, Chairman Deepak Parekh said he spent "two sleepless nights" prior to the development. "After 45 years of housing finance and 9 million homes provided to Indians, we had to find a home for ourselves. We have found it within our own family and in our own bank," Parekh further said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I can't be on board of merged bank, I've crossed 75 yrs of age: HDFC Chairman
text: HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said on Monday that he will not be on the board of the merged entity, once HDFC combines with HDFC Bank. "The RBI does not allow anyone above the age of 75 years to be on the board of a bank. I have already crossed that age," the 77-year-old said. Parekh had joined HDFC in 1978.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: HDFC-HDFC Bank combined entity will be among world's 100 most-valued firms
text: The combined entity formed out of the HDFC Bank-HDFC merger will be among the world's 100 most-valued firms in terms of market capitalisation, as per Bloomberg data. The entity will likely be worth $190 billion (over ₹14 lakh crore), making it the 63rd most-valued company globally. Currently, Apple is the world's most-valued company with a market value of $2.84 trillion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Crypto payments worth ₹2.2 cr made in 11 drug trafficking cases: Govt
text: Narcotics Control Bureau and Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs have unearthed crypto payments worth ₹2.2 crore in 11 drug trafficking cases, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. Government is taking steps to check such usage, he added. Liaisoning with technical experts and coordination with foreign drug law enforcement agencies is being done regularly, Chaudhary said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Paytm Payments Bank yet to appoint firm for IT audit: Govt
text: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said Paytm Payments Bank hasn't yet appointed a firm to conduct an audit of its IT systems. On March 11, RBI barred the bank from onboarding new customers and ordered it to appoint an audit firm. Order followed a report that the bank allegedly leaked data to Chinese entities, Bloomberg reported citing sources.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Unemployment rate dropping in India, fell to 7.6% in March: CMIE
text: India's unemployment rate is decreasing and fell to 7.6% in March 2022, the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy's (CMIE) data showed. The unemployment ratio further dropped to 7.5% on April 2, with urban unemployment at 8.5% and rural at 7.1%. Haryana recorded the highest unemployment rate in March at 26.7%, while Gujarat and Karnataka recorded the lowest at 1.8%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India continues to remain highest receiver of FDI: FM Sitharaman
text: India has been the highest receiver of foreign direct investment (FDI) since before COVID-19 and continues to be so even now, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. She added that Indian retail investors have created the capacity to absorb shocks due to outflow of foreign funds. Earlier, data showed that foreign portfolio investors withdrew ₹1.48 lakh crore from October 2021-March 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FPIs withdraw ₹41,000 cr in Mar, become net sellers for 6th month
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹41,123 crore from the Indian equity market in March 2022. With this, FPIs became net sellers for the sixth consecutive month, having withdrawn net ₹1.48 lakh crore between October 2021 and March 2022. Apart from equities, the debt segment witnessed net outflows of ₹5,632 crore in March.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Over ₹53,000 crore owed to states as FY22's GST compensation: Govt
text: The central government still owes ₹53,489 crore to states and UTs in GST compensation for the period between April 2021 and January 2022, the Finance Ministry said on Monday. Of this, the maximum amount is owed to Maharashtra at ₹11,563 crore. The Centre borrowed ₹1.59 lakh crore in FY22 to make up for the shortfall in GST compensation cess collections.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: For ₹1,400 crore, Amazon destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company: Future Retail
text: Future Retail told the Supreme Court that "for ₹1,400 crore, Amazon has destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company". Future's lawyer was referring to the ₹1,400 crore deal between Amazon and Future Coupons, which Amazon has cited to block the deal between Future and Reliance Retail. "We are hanging by a thread...No one wants to do business with us now," Future's lawyer said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's exports touch record high of $417.8 bn in FY22, govt calls it 'historic'
text: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday announced that India's exports touched a record high of $417.8 billion in FY22, and called the milestone "historic". "It's the first time that the country's yearly exports have reached this figure and the exports were 5% above the set target," Goyal said. Goods worth $40 billion were exported in March 2022 alone.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 11th time in 13 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 11th time in 13 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹103.41/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹94.67/litre from ₹93.87/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹118.41/litre from ₹117.57/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹102.64/litre from ₹101.79/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Pradeep Mehra receives ₹2.5 lakh from Shoppers Stop, Kapri shares post
text: Shoppers Stop has given a cheque of ₹2.5 lakh to 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra for his mother’s treatment and to accomplish his dream of joining the Indian Army. Filmmaker Vinod Kapri tweeted about this and wrote, "Midnight runner Pradeep Mehra is overwhelmed with all the love and support." Earlier in March, Mehra's video of running in Noida had gone viral.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: WHO suspends UN supply of Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine
text: The WHO has suspended the supply through United Nations agencies of Covaxin, the COVID-19 vaccine produced by India's Bharat Biotech. Reuters and Bloomberg reported that the suspension is to allow the manufacturer to upgrade facilities and address deficiencies found in an inspection. "The WHO said the vaccine is effective and no safety concerns exist," the reports added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Infosys to shut Russia office amid pressure over Ukraine war: Reports
text: Indian IT major Infosys is closing its office in Russia after facing pressure to stop operating amid Russia's war with Ukraine, reports said. Earlier, UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak faced questions over his wife Akshata's stake in Infosys, which was co-founded by her father Narayana Murthy. Infosys is trying to find replacement roles abroad for Moscow employees, BBC reported.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: COVID-19 boosters are essential, we shouldn't delay: Shaw to Health Minister
text: Biocon Limited's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted to Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Sunday and said that announcing booster shots of COVID-19 vaccines can help prevent the wastage of unused stocks. "All healthcare institutions are worried about unused stocks of vaccines that will expire soon," she said, adding that COVID-19 "boosters are essential and we should not delay".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Peace? I hate the word: World's richest person Elon Musk
text: The world's richest person, Elon Musk, on Sunday tweeted, "Peace. Peace? I hate the word. Those who do care about peace (myself aspirationally included) don't need to hear it...And those who don't care about peace? Well..." In an earlier tweet, he wrote, "They wrote PEACE on the wall at Berghain! I refused (to) enter." Berghain is a nightclub in Berlin.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Shein planning to raise funds at a valuation of $100 billion: Report
text: Chinese fashion e-commerce startup Shein is planning to raise funds at a valuation of about $100 billion, Bloomberg reported on Sunday. The company is in talks with potential investors to raise about $1 billion, the report said. Backed by Sequoia Capital China, IDG Capital and Tiger Global, Shein denied plans to launch an initial public offering (IPO) last month.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India & Australia sign trade pact, 96% Indian goods to get duty free access
text: India and Australia on Saturday signed the Economic Cooperation & Trade Agreement to boost economic ties. Under the pact, over 96% Indian goods will get duty free access to Australia's market. "This is truly a watershed moment," PM Narendra Modi said. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said the agreement will take bilateral trade to $45-50 billion in the next five years.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Petrol gets costlier by ₹7.20 per litre with 10 hikes in 12 days
text: Petrol and diesel have become costlier by ₹7.20 per litre each as the prices have been hiked 10 times since a four-and-half-month long pause in rate revision ended on March 22. Petrol price neared ₹103 per litre in Delhi on Saturday and crossed ₹117 in Mumbai after a hike of over 80 paise. Diesel price hit ₹93.87/litre in Delhi.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which sectors will benefit from India's historic trade pact with Australia?
text: Several labour-intensive sectors will get duty-free access to markets in Australia under the historic economic cooperation and trade agreement signed by India and Australia. These include textiles and apparel, leather and footwear, select agricultural and fish products, gems and jewellery, pharma and machinery and electrical goods sectors. Overall, 96% of Indian goods will get duty-free access.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ready-to-eat popcorn to attract 18% GST, clarifies Telangana AAR
text: Ready-to-eat popcorn is prepared by swelling maize corn and should attract 18% GST, Telangana Authority for Advanced Ruling (AAR) has clarified. It noted that ready-to-eat popcorn falls under the category of prepared foods obtained by swelling or roasting of cereals or cereal products. It "clearly does not fall under" the category pertaining to preparations of vegetables, fruits, nuts, it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Criminal probe ordered after UK ferry firm fired 786 employees on Zoom call
text: UK's P&O Ferries is under criminal and civil investigation after it fired 786 employees over a Zoom call without notice and replaced them with lower-paid crew. The company's CEO Peter Hebblethwaite "stood before MPs and admitted to breaking the law and his actions must now be scrutinised", UK Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said. Hebblethwaite said unions weren't consulted before layoffs.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who are the world's 10 richest people as Adani enters $100 billion club?
text: Elon Musk is the world's richest person with $273 billion fortune, Bloomberg said, followed by Jeff Bezos ($188 billion). While Gautam Adani is 10th richest with $100 billion wealth, the list includes Bernard Arnault ($148 billion), Bill Gates ($133 billion) and Warren Buffett ($127 billion). Google Co-founders Larry Page ($125 billion) and Sergey Brin ($119 billion) rank sixth and seventh.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: No meat in our products: Himalaya after #BoycottHimalaya trends over halal policy
text: Himalaya on Friday issued a statement after a group of people started to call for #BoycottHimalaya over its halal policy. The company said, "None of the Himalaya products contain meat, as alleged in some of the social media platforms; this is factually incorrect." It added, that halal certification "does not imply that a product contains animal-derived ingredients."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Future Enterprises misses due date to repay ₹2,835 crore to lenders
text: Future Enterprises has informed the stock exchanges that it has missed the due date of March 31, 2022, to repay ₹2,835.65 crore to various consortium banks and lenders. On Friday, Future Retail (FRL) said it had defaulted on a loan repayment of ₹5,322.32 crore and also failed to raise ₹3,900 crore. FRL cited ongoing litigations with Amazon as the reason.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Nepal becomes 4th country to launch India's e-payment system RuPay
text: Nepal on Saturday became the fourth country in the world to operationalise India's e-payment system RuPay. The three other countries that have the RuPay card are Bhutan, Singapore and the United Arab Emirates. The Indian External Affairs Ministry said the launch of the card in Nepal would open new vistas for cooperation in financial connectivity and further strengthen people-to-people linkages.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Will fulfil commitments on crypto, bank privatisation: FM Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that the government will fulfil commitments on issues like bank privatisation and cryptocurrency regulation. Speaking at the CNBC-TV18 India Business Leader Awards event, she added, "These are commitments which we have to fulfil. We will be moving forward, you will get to know when."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: BharatPe board aiming for IPO in 18-24 months: Chairman
text: BharatPe Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said the firm's board, founders and management want to take it public in the next 18-24 months. He added the board will also be expanded with more independent directors in future. He also revealed that there have been investor queries for funding and despite the negative press, BharatPe's valuation should be higher than $2.8 billion.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: BharatPe has appointed Alvarez & Marsal exec as interim CFO: Chairman
text: BharatPe has appointed an executive from Alvarez & Marsal as its interim CFO, Chairman Rajnish Kumar said. The firm is in search of a permanent CFO and Kumar said it is in the "advanced stages" to appoint one. Kumar added that the board, founders, and management are exploring taking the firm public in the next 18-24 months.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tesla delivers record 3,10,048 cars in Q1 as Musk calls it 'difficult quarter'
text: Tesla reported that it delivered record number of electric vehicles in the first quarter of 2022, despite ongoing supply chain challenges and factory shutdowns. Tesla said it delivered 3,10,048 vehicles during the first three months of this year. "This was an exceptionally difficult quarter due to supply chain interruptions & China's Zero COVID policy," Tesla's billionaire CEO Elon Musk said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Pune diesel prices rise to ₹100.60 per litre after 11th hike in 13 days
text: The diesel prices in Pune crossed the ₹100 per litre mark on Sunday after the 11th hike in prices in 13 days. The diesel in the city now costs ₹100.60 per litre, a rise of 83 paise from April 2, while petrol costs ₹117.87 per litre. The diesel price in Mumbai has been increased to ₹102.64 per litre from ₹101.79/litre.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Power regulator caps prices at ₹12/unit at exchanges amid rising demand
text:
The Central Electricity Regulatory Commission has asked the electricity exchanges to cap prices at 
₹12 per unit amid a surge in power demand. The power regulator said prices at power exchanges have remained "significantly" higher during the last few days. "Abnormally high price...is not only against consumer interest but also erodes the buyer's confidence in the market's credibility," it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Uber raises cab fares by 15% in Mumbai as fuel prices go up
text: App-based taxi firm Uber has raised fares by 15% for travel in Mumbai to offset the impact of rising fuel prices, the company said. Fuel prices have been hiked for the 10th time in 12 days across the country on Saturday. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹117.57/litre from ₹116.72/litre while diesel price has increased to ₹101.79/litre from ₹100.94/litre.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: B'luru petrol prices reach ₹108.14/litre after 10th hike in 12 days
text: After fuel prices were hiked for the 10th time in 12 days, the price of petrol has reached ₹108.14/litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹92.05/litre, according to the Indian Express. In total, the price of petrol has gone up by ₹7.20/litre. Earlier, Karnataka Congress leaders had staged a protest against the hike in fuel prices in Bengaluru.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Talk of stagflation in India is 'overhyped': NITI Aayog VC
text: India is on the cusp of a major economic recovery and talks of possible stagflation are "overhyped", said NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar. "I am sure that the RBI is well in control of [inflation] and will take necessary steps if and when required," Kumar said. Despite the Russia-Ukraine war, "India will remain the fastest growing economy", he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Domestic PNG gets costlier by ₹5.85 in Delhi & Noida as IGL hikes prices
text: The Indraprastha Gas Limited said on Friday that it's hiking the price of domestic PNG by ₹5.85 from April 1 to partially cover the hike in input gas cost. With this, per standard cubic metre (SCM) will cost ₹41.61, including VAT, in Delhi. It will cost ₹41.71/SCM in Gautam Buddha Nagar. Previously, the price was hiked on March 24.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Why shouldn't I buy if there's a discount?: FM on India buying Russian oil
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman at a CNBC-TV18 event said that India has already started buying oil from Russia and has bought at least 3-4 days of supply. She asked, "Why shouldn't I buy (oil) if supply is available at a discounted rate?" She added, "I would put my country's national interest and energy security first."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: What are the income tax rule changes effective from today?
text: Income from virtual digital assets (VDAs) will be taxed at 30% and losses incurred from one VDA can't be set off against income from another VDA. A cap of tax-free contributions up to ₹2.5 lakh will be imposed on Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) account. A surcharge on long term capital gains tax will be capped at 15% for all assets.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: GST collections hit all-time high of ₹1.42 lakh crore in March 2022
text: The gross GST revenue collected in the month of March 2022 hit an all-time high of ₹1,42,095 crore, breaching the earlier record of ₹1,40,986 crore collected in January 2022, the government said on Friday. Of the ₹1,42,095 crore, CGST is ₹25,830 crore, SGST is ₹ 32,378 crore, IGST is ₹74,470 crore and cess is ₹9,417 crore.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: LPG cylinder for commercial use gets costlier by ₹250 from today
text: The price of commercial LPG cylinders has been hiked by ₹250 with effect from today. With the latest hike, a 19-kg commercial cylinder will now cost ₹2,253 in Delhi, ₹2,205 in Mumbai, ₹2,351.5 in Kolkata and ₹2,406 in Chennai. However, the domestic LPG cylinder rates and petrol and diesel prices were kept unchanged on Friday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Gautam Adani's fortune hits $100 billion mark, surpasses Mukesh Ambani's
text: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's net worth has hit the $100 billion mark after surging by nearly $24 billion this year. He's the world's biggest gainer this year and now the world's 10th richest person, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Adani has overtaken Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani, whose fortune stands at $99 billion, and become Asia's richest person again.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sequoia India MD's 15-year-old son builds app for Ukraine refugees to find help
text: Sequoia India MD GV Ravi Shankar's 15-year-old son Tejas has built an app for Ukrainian refugees in neighbouring countries to get help from locals offering to assist them. He built the app in two weeks. The app includes a map to find closest help locations, verification features based on national IDs across the world and listings offering necessities like food.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt not planning a law soon to regulate cryptocurrencies: Report
text: The government isn't planning a law soon to either regulate or tighten provisions relating to cryptocurrencies, Bloomberg reported on Friday. The Indian government will frame a law for cryptocurrencies only after a global consensus emerges on regulating such assets, the report added. During the Budget, the government announced a 30% tax on income from virtual digital assets from April 1.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I'm not that rich: CEO of world's largest crypto exchange on $74 billion net worth
text: After Fortune magazine featured world's largest crypto exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao on its cover, the billionaire wrote, "[I'm] really not that rich, but honoured to be featured on the cover." The magazine had mentioned that the 44-year-old's estimated net worth is $74 billion and that Bitcoin boom had made him as rich as Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg "virtually overnight".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sanders compares Bezos & Musk's 'joy rides to space' to oligarchy, video goes viral
text: US Senator Bernie Sanders in a recent speech said, "Anyone who thinks we don't have...oligarchy right here in America is sorely mistaken." "Multi-billionaires like Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, Richard Branson are off taking joy rides on their rocket ships to outer space," he added. "They're buying $500 million superyachts. And we talk about the yachts...Putin's friends have," Sanders stated.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon's Andy Jassy gets $212 million compensation in his 1st year as CEO
text: Amazon's Andy Jassy, who took over as CEO in July 2021, received a compensation of about $212 million last year. While Jassy's base salary remained unchanged at $175,000, the vast majority of his compensation came in the form of a stock award of 61,000 shares. That award "is expected to represent most of Jassy's compensation for coming years", Amazon said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon workers at NY warehouse vote to form company's first US union
text: Workers at an Amazon warehouse in New York's Staten Island have voted in favour of forming a union, making it the e-commerce giant's first facility in the US to organise. The workers secured a majority as 2,654 voted in favour of joining the union, while 2,131 opposed. Amazon is the second largest private employer in the US, Reuters said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Commend K'taka CM for asking for restraint: Shaw on Bommai's response
text: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw on Thursday appreciated Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai for calling for restraint and saying that social issues can be resolved through discussions. Earlier, she urged Bommai to resolve the "growing religious divide". Subsequently, Bommai said, "Karnataka is known for peace and progress and everyone should observe restraint."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Illegal business expenses of ₹800 crore found at Hero MotoCorp: I-T Dept
text: The Income Tax Department found illegal business expenses of over ₹800 crore after it conducted a search and seizure operation at Hero MotoCorp's premises. It said that ₹60 crore in "unaccounted" cash was used to purchase 10 acre of farm land in Delhi. "The ultimate...beneficiary of the land deal is a prominent person of the automobile manufacturer group," it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon has destroyed us: Future Retail to Supreme Court
text: Advocate Harish Salve, appearing for Future Retail in the Supreme Court, said, "Amazon wanted to destroy us...they've destroyed us." He was referring to the Amazon's litigation to block the ₹27,000-crore asset sale deal between Future and Reliance Retail. The court was hearing Amazon's plea to restrain Future from alienating its retail assets until arbitration between the companies concluded.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 10th time in 12 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 10th time in 12 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹102.61/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹93.87/litre from ₹93.07/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹117.57/litre from ₹116.72/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹101.79/litre from ₹100.94/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: At least I didn't slap anybody: UK FM on criticism of his wife over Infosys stake
text: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak likened himself to Will Smith after his wife Akshata Murthy faced criticism for owning Infosys shares, which allegedly has a Russian presence. "At least I didn't get up and slap anybody, which is good," Sunak told BBC. He further said, "It's totally fine for people to take shots at me...It's...upsetting...for people to...come at my wife."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Evergreen's 'Ever Forward' ship stuck near Baltimore for 3 weeks
text: Evergreen Marine Corporation's 1,096-foot container ship 'Ever Forward' ran aground in the Chesapeake Bay after departing the Port of Baltimore's Seagirt Marine Terminal on March 13 and hasn't moved since, according to Bloomberg. After two failed attempts, Evergreen is planning another attempt as early as Sunday to free the ship. In 2021, Evergreen's 'Ever Given' ship blocked the Suez Canal.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Future Retail misses due date to repay ₹5,322 crore to its lenders
text: Future Retail (FRL) on Friday said it has missed the due date for the repayment of ₹5,322.32 crore to various banks and lenders. The company also said that it failed to raise ₹3,900 crore before March 31, 2022, under the One Time Restructuring (OTR) scheme. FRL said it was unable to do so due to the ongoing litigations with Amazon.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sensex ends 708 points higher at 59,277 on 1st day of new financial year
text: The Indian benchmark indices ended over 1% higher on the first day of the new financial year. The Sensex jumped 708 points to end at 59,277, while the broader Nifty 50 surged 206 points to close at 17,670.50. NTPC, Power Grid Corporation and IndusInd Bank were among the top Sensex gainers. Sensex added nearly 2,000 points this week.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Future Retail CEO Sadashiv Nayak resigns after 7 months of his appointment
text: Future Retail's CEO Sadashiv Nayak has resigned from his role, more than seven months after taking up the role. Nayak has been with Future Group for around 18 years and had been appointed CEO in August 2021. This comes amid Future Retail's legal battle with US e-commerce giant Amazon over a $3.4-billion sale of its retail assets to Reliance Industries.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Glad I didn't get an MBA, experience is the best teacher: Marico Founder
text: Harsh Mariwala, the Founder of 'Parachute' oil maker Marico, revealed that he was an average student and shy and neither of those qualities helped him when he wanted to join a B-school. "Initially, I regretted not getting an MBA. But in hindsight, I'm glad I didn't. Experience is the best teacher you can have," the 72-year-old businessman wrote on Twitter.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Adani gains $21 billion in 3 months, more than the world's 5 richest men
text: Asia's second richest person and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's fortune has surged by $21.1 billion so far this year, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. He made more money than the world's five richest people, including Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos and Warren Buffett, in three months. Meanwhile, Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani's fortune surged $8.24 billion in the same period.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Maruti Suzuki exports hit record high of 2.38 lakh units in FY22
text: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki revealed that its exports surged to 2.38 lakh units in FY22, the highest in any financial year. The company exported 26,496 units during March 2022, clocking its highest ever monthly exports. For the full financial year 2021-22, the company posted a total sales of 16.5 lakh units with a growth of 13.4% over FY 2020-21.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Rupee-rouble trade has been ongoing for years: Russian Foreign Minister
text: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, who's visiting India, said on Friday that the rupee-rouble payments system has been going on for many years. "The reason for moving towards national currencies...is the unreliable nature of our Western counterparts," he added. He further said, "We don't want to be a part of a system whose masters can steal your money overnight."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Banks' consortium releases ₹150 cr for stalled Amrapali projects
text: The first instalment of ₹150 crore has been released by a consortium of seven banks for completion of stalled Amrapali projects in the NCR. The consortium will be disbursing a total sum of ₹1,500 crore for the construction of over 5,100 units in Amrapali projects in Noida and Greater Noida. Nearly 40,000 homebuyers are awaiting possession in the projects.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Corporate India's mood is cautiously optimistic: Uday Kotak
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak said that corporate India's mood is "cautiously optimistic" now that the post-COVID-19 economy is showing signs of bouncing back. Speaking about inflation, Kotak told CNBC-TV18, "India is not so much out of line given our inflation. The path we...need to traverse is a smaller move compared to what the developed markets have to."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt allows PAN-Aadhaar linking till March 31, 2023 with payment of fine
text: The Central Board of Direct Taxes has announced that Aadhaar card and Permanent Account Number (PAN) can be linked till March 31, 2023. However, linking the two from April 1, 2022 will attract a fine of ₹500 till June 2022 and ₹1,000 after that. Earlier, CBDT said PAN would become inoperative if not linked with Aadhaar by March 31, 2022.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Kim Kardashian, Rihanna make debut on Hurun's self-made women billionaires list
text: American socialite Kim Kardashian and Barbadian singer Rihanna have made their debut on the Hurun Richest Self-Made Women in the World 2022 list with a net worth of $2 billion and $1 billion, respectively. The 41-year-old Kardashian is the Founder of KKW Beauty and shapewear brand Skims, while 34-year-old Rihanna is the Founder of cosmetics brand Fenty Beauty.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia offers oil to India at discount of $35 a barrel on prices before war: Report
text: Russia has offered oil to India at a steep discount of as much as $35 per barrel on prices before the war to encourage India to buy more shipments, Bloomberg reported citing sources. The sanctions-hit country reportedly wants India to take 115 million barrels contracted for this year to begin with and talks are taking place at a government level.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who are the world's youngest self-made female billionaires as per Hurun?
text: Bumble's 32-year-old Founder Whitney Wolfe Herd is the world's youngest self-made woman billionaire with $1 billion net worth, as per Hurun. She's followed by 34-year-old singer and Fenty Beauty Founder Rihanna with $1 billion wealth and Canva's 34-year-old Co-founder Melanie Perkins with $6 billion. Diamond brand DR's Lu Yiwen (35) and Confluent's Neha Narkhede (37) are also on the list.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: It's possible to resolve issues through talks: Karnataka CM on Kiran Shaw's tweet
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said that the state is known for peace and progress and it is possible to resolve social issues through peaceful talks. He added, "Everyone should show restraint." This comes after Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted, "If ITBT became communal it would destroy our global leadership", and urged Bommai to resolve the "growing religious divide".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Who is Zoho's Radha Vembu, India's 3rd richest self-made woman billionaire?
text: Radha Vembu, who holds a majority stake in Zoho, has been named India's third-richest self-made woman billionaire by Hurun with $3.9 billion wealth. The 49-year-old billionaire has been the product manager of Zoho Mail since 2007. She has a degree in industrial management from IIT-Madras. Zoho was co-founded by her brother Sridhar Vembu. She also looks after Zoho Workplace.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: I do surfing: Mark Zuckerberg on how he deals with 'bad news' around the world
text: Mark Zuckerberg revealed in an interview that he tries to do surfing or foiling every morning to absorb "bad news" coming from Meta or around the world. "If I...go straight into the day...it's almost like getting punched with a ton of new context," he said. "When you're...in the water, it's pretty hard to focus on anything else," Meta CEO explained.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Woman, who claimed she's Apple CEO's wife & threatened him, agrees to stay away
text: A woman who's been accused of stalking Tim Cook said she'll stay away from the Apple CEO and his family until 2025, according to a court agreement filed in US. She also cannot communicate with Cook via social media. The 45-year-old claimed to be Cook's wife and threatened him by sending pictures of a loaded pistol, as per Apple.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Communalism will destroy India's global leadership in IT: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
text: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has urged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to resolve the "growing religious divide" in state. She tweeted, "Karnataka has always forged inclusive economic development and we must not allow communal exclusion - If ITBT became communal it would destroy our global leadership." This comes amid reports of banning Muslim traders from temple festivals.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: My comments aren't politically coloured: Shaw to BJP leader on communalism tweet
text: Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw told BJP's IT cell head Amit Malviya on Twitter, "I...assure you that my comments aren't politically coloured." Malviya alleged that Shaw was imposing her "politically coloured opinion" after she asked CM Basavaraj Bommai to resolve the "growing religious divide" in Karnataka. Shaw said that communalism would destroy India's global leadership in IT.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's richest self-made woman's Nykaa among TIME's 100 most influential firms
text: Nykaa, the beauty e-commerce company led by Falguni Nayar, has made it to TIME's list of 100 most influential companies for 2022. "Nearly 10 million people shop at Nykaa, and a November IPO raised $700 million at a $13 billion valuation—turning Nayar, the CEO, into India's richest self-made businesswoman," TIME magazine said. The 59-year-old entrepreneur founded Nykaa in 2012.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nykaa's Falguni Nayar among world's top 10 richest self-made women: Hurun
text: Nykaa Founder Falguni Nayar is among the world's top 10 richest self-made women with a $7.6 billion net worth, as per Hurun Richest Self-Made Women in the World 2022 list. Nayar, whose company went public last year, entered the top 10 for the first time and is the only Indian among the top 10, Hurun said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: PIL seeking Bharat Ratna for Ratan Tata rejected, HC says 'what kind of petition is this'
text: Delhi High Court has rejected to entertain a public interest litigation seeking a direction to the central government to award Bharat Ratna to industrialist Ratan Tata. "What kind of a petition is this? Is this for the court to direct (the government to award Bharat Ratna)," the court said. The petitioner urged the court to "at least request" the government.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 9th time in 10 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the ninth time in 10 days. Petrol in Delhi will now cost ₹101.81 per litre while diesel rates have gone up to ₹93.07 per litre after prices were hiked by 80 paise a litre each. In Mumbai, petrol and diesel prices per litre are at ₹116.72 and ₹100.94 after an 84-paisa hike.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Who are the world's top 10 richest self-made women billionaires as per Hurun?
text: Beijing-based property developer Wu Yajun is the world's richest self-made female billionaire with a $17 billion fortune, as per Hurun's latest list. Chinese billionaires Fan Hongwei, Grace Wang Laichun and Zhong Huijuan stood second, third and fourth with a fortune of $13 billion, $11 billion and $10 billion, respectively. US-based ABC Supply's owner Diane Hendricks stood sixth with $9 billion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Apollo Tyres confirms CCI visited offices, says we're cooperating with probe
text: Apollo Tyres confirmed that Competition Commission of India (CCI) officials visited its offices after reports said that several tyre makers were raided by the regulator over suspected law violations. "We're fully cooperating with the...investigation and have provided all the details required. We're of the firm view that we have acted...in compliance with the competition laws," Apollo Tyres said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Went beyond expectations to keep Future out of harm's way: Reliance on stores takeover
text: Reliance Industries privately defended a takeover of Future Retail's stores, as per a company letter seen by Reuters. In the letter, Reliance said it went "truly beyond what can be expected" to keep Future "out of harm's way". RIL took significant steps, including a ₹4,800-crore financial support, comprising ₹1,100 crore of unpaid leases and ₹3,700 crore working capital, it added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Volkswagen to recall over 1 lakh cars globally over fire risk
text: Volkswagen Group will have to recall over one lakh plug-in hybrid vehicles globally due to risk of fire, a spokesperson for the German carmaker said. Volkswagen brand Audi has to recall 24,400 cars while Seat and Skoda will also be affected. The fire risk can arise from "inadequate fastening of the engine design cover", German motor transport authority KBA said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Women-led MSMEs rose 75% to 8.59 lakh units in FY22: MoS MSMEs
text: Minister of State for MSMEs BPS Verma on Thursday said the number of women-led MSMEs in India rose 75% YoY to 8.59 lakh units in FY22. There were 4.9 lakh women-led MSMEs in FY21. As per RBI data, of the 211.65 crore accounts in scheduled commercial banks, 70.64 crore accounts, or 33.37%, belong to female account holders, Verma said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Petrol price crosses ₹107/L-mark, diesel at ₹91.27/L in B'luru
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the ninth time in 10 days across the country on Thursday. Following the latest price revision, petrol in Karnataka capital, Bengaluru, now costs ₹107.30 per litre, while diesel now costs ₹91.27 per litre. In Delhi, petrol is priced at ₹101.81 per litre while in Mumbai it's at ₹116.72 per litre.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: GAIL to buyback about 5.7 crore shares for ₹1,083 crore
text: GAIL (India) Limited said it will buyback about 5.7 crore shares for ₹1,083 crore at the rate of ₹190/share. On the back of a healthy balance sheet, the company aims to reward shareholders for the second time since FY21 when GAIL had spent ₹1,046.35 crore on a similar buyback. The government is likely to participate in the buyback.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Centre to borrow ₹8.45 lakh crore via bonds in Apr-Sept 2022
text: The central government will borrow ₹8.45 lakh crore between April and September 2022 by issuing bonds, the Finance Ministry said. This sum amounts to 56.5% of the full-year borrowing programme of ₹14.95 lakh crore as spelt out in Budget 2022. The bonds, with different maturity periods, will be issued via auctions ranging in size from ₹32,000 crore to ₹33,000 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Air India & its subsidiaries posted ₹17,032 cr loss in Apr 2020-Dec 2021
text: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said Air India (AI), AI Express and Alliance Air suffered a total loss of ₹17,032 crore between April 2020-December 2021. The highest loss, at ₹9,373 crore in FY21 and at ₹6,927 crore in FY22 (till December), was incurred by Air India, Scindia added. Air India and AI Express are now part of the Tata Group.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Deal of a lifetime: Axis Bank CEO on Citibank's India portfolio buyout
text: Axis Bank's acquisition of Citibank's India consumer business is a "deal of a lifetime", said Axis Bank MD and CEO Amitabh Chaudhry. The $1.6 billion (over ₹12,100 crore) all-cash deal also includes the sale of consumer business of Citibank's NBFC Citicorp Finance (India) Limited, Citigroup said. The buyout will give Axis Bank access to 2.5 million Citibank customer cards.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Foreign investors sell net $5.4 billion in 1st half of March 2022
text: Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) sold net $5.4 billion worth of Indian equities in the first 15 days of March 2022, continuing their five month-long net selling streak. The outflow in March 2022's first half has been the highest since March 2020. FIIs sold financials worth $2.9 billion and discretionary products worth $1.2 billion, the highest sector-wise outflows since March 2017.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Court rejects SpiceJet promoter Ajay Singh's bail plea: Reports
text: A Delhi court has rejected SpiceJet promoter Ajay Singh's anticipatory bail plea, Moneycontrol reported. Senior Advocate Vikas Pahwa, who is representing the complainant, said Singh had not been cooperating with the investigating agencies and had also misdirected them. Singh moved the court after two non-bailable warrants were issued against him for failing to appear for investigation.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 7 banks to release ₹1,500 crore for stalled Amrapali projects
text: A consortium of seven public sector banks has signed an agreement with Amrapali Stalled Projects and Investment Reconstruction Establishment for disbursal of a ₹1,500 crore loan for stalled Amrapali projects. Supreme Court had earlier directed the consortium to release the amount by March 29. The loan amount will be used for construction of over 5,100 Amrapali units in NCR.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Don’t give a buck, says Kotak, offers no brokerage plan on Demat account
text: Kotak Securities has launched 'No Brokerage Plan' allowing customers to open Demat accounts with no brokerage on any transactions, including intraday and delivery trades across equity, currency, commodity, and F&O segments. People aged under 30 years can subscribe to the plan for a yearly payment of ₹499. Those opting for this plan will also get vouchers worth ₹1,998 post onboarding.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Who are world's 10 richest self-made billionaires aged 40 & under as per Hurun?
text: Meta's 37-year-old CEO Mark Zuckerberg is the world's richest self-made billionaire aged 40 and under with $76 billion wealth, according to M3M Hurun Global U40 Self-Made Billionaires 2022 list. He's followed by ByteDance CEO Zhang Yiming, FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried and Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky. Facebook Co-founder Dustin Moskovitz, and Airbnb's Nathan and Joe Gebbia are worth $13 billion each.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: DA for central govt employees, pensioners hiked by 3% to 34%
text: The Cabinet has approved a 3% hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) for central government employees and Dearness Relief (DR) for pensioners, effective from January 1, 2022. The hike will take the figure to 34%. In October 2021, DA was hiked from 28% to 31%. The move is expected to benefit 47.68 lakh government employees and 68.62 lakh pensioners.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 8th time in 9 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the eighth time in nine days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹101.01/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹92.27/litre from ₹91.47/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹115.88/litre from ₹115.04/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹100.10/litre from ₹99.25/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Which banks recorded the highest value of frauds in 9 months as per govt data?
text: Twenty-seven scheduled commercial banks and financial institutions reported 96 cases of frauds of over ₹100 crore from April-December 2021, amounting to ₹34,097 crore, RBI data showed. PNB recorded the highest value of frauds at ₹4,820 crore. Bank of India recorded frauds worth ₹3,925 crore, SBI recorded frauds worth ₹3,902 crore, while Yes Bank recorded frauds worth ₹3,869 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: CEAT, Apollo Tyres raided by CCI over suspected law violations: Reports
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Wednesday raided offices of tyre companies including Germany's Continental AG and India's Apollo Tyres and CEAT, reports said. The raids were conducted in a case of suspected competition law violations, Reuters reported. Shares of Apollo fell as much as 3% after reports of the raids, while CEAT dropped 2.2%.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who are India's most valuable celebrities as per Duff & Phelps' latest report?
text: Virat Kohli has been named as India's most valuable celebrity for the fifth year in a row in Duff & Phelps' latest celebrity valuation report with a brand value of $185.7 million. He's followed by Ranveer Singh ($158.3 million), Akshay Kumar ($139.6 million), Alia Bhatt ($68.1 million), MS Dhoni  ($61.2 million), Amitabh Bachchan ($54.2 million) and Deepika Padukone ($51.6 million).
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Russia offers India a system for rupee-ruble payments, India considering it: Report
text: Russia has proposed to India to use a system developed by Russian central bank for bilateral payments and India is considering it, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday. Russia's plan involves rupee-ruble-denominated payments using Russia's messaging system SPFS, the report added. Rubles will reportedly be deposited into an Indian bank and converted into rupees, and the same system will work in reverse.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Musk quotes Eminem song in US court, says 'SEC won't let me be or let me be me'
text: Tesla's billionaire CEO Elon Musk quoted Eminem's song "Without Me" in a US court filing and said, "The (SEC) won't let me be or let me be me so let me see; They tried to shut me down." The filing was in connection with his 2018 agreement with Securities and Exchange Commission requiring him to obtain pre-approval for his tweets.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Paytm got customers through cashbacks, not by offering services: HDFC Bank's ex-MD
text: Veteran banker Aditya Puri said that unlike a bank, which books revenues for offering services and reports profit, Paytm has garnered millions of customers by offering cashbacks. "Paytm...he makes payments, when did he make profit," the former HDFC Bank MD added at an event. His comments came amid a decline in Paytm's shares, which are 75% below their IPO price.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Report is flawed: FM on World Inequality Report terming India 'poor, very unequal'
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said that the World Inequality Report, which called India a "poor and very unequal country", is flawed. The report is based on questionable methodology, Sitharaman added. The World Inequality Report 2022, which was published in December 2021, had said that "India is now among the most unequal countries in the world".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Petrol gets costlier by ₹5.60 per litre with 8 hikes in 9 days
text: Petrol and diesel have become costlier by ₹5.60 per litre each as the prices have been hiked by eight times since March 22. Petrol price crossed ₹100 a litre in Delhi on Tuesday, while diesel in Mumbai soared above the mark on Wednesday. With the latest rise, petrol is selling at ₹101.01 a litre in Delhi and diesel at ₹92.27.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which nations have the most self-made billionaires aged 40 & under as per Hurun?
text: In its latest report on self-made billionaires aged 40 years and under, Hurun Research Institute said that the US has the most number of such billionaires at 37. China (25 billionaires), the UK (eight), India (six) and Sweden (three) were also among the top five. Brazil and UAE have two self-made U40 billionaires each.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Hero MotoCorp denies reports of I-T dept finding ₹1,000 crore bogus expenses
text: Hero MotoCorp has "categorically denied" reports claiming that the Income Tax Department detected bogus expenses to the tune of ₹1,000 crore during recent raids at its offices. "The allegations...are not borne out of any document that have been served on us or our internal documents," the company said. Shares of Hero MotoCorp ended 6.68% lower on Tuesday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Kerala-born billionaire Yusuffali's Lulu Group planning IPO in UAE: Report
text: Kerala-born billionaire Yusuffali M A's LuLu Group, which operates hypermarkets and retail companies in the Middle East, is considering an IPO in 2023 in the UAE, Bloomberg reported. Valued at more than $5 billion in 2020, Lulu asked global banks to pitch for roles for potential listings. The group also operates shopping malls and businesses including hospitality and real estate.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Axis Bank to buy Citibank's India consumer business for ₹12,100 crore
text: Axis Bank will acquire Citibank's India consumer business, which includes credit cards, wealth management, retail banking and consumer loans, for $1.6 billion (over ₹12,100 crore) in an all-cash deal. The transaction also includes the sale of consumer business of Citi's NBFC, Citicorp Finance (India) Limited, Citigroup said. About 3,600 of Citi's employees will transfer to Axis Bank.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Gautam Adani adds $20 billion to his fortune this year, highest among Indians
text: India's second richest person Gautam Adani has added over $20 billion to his fortune in 2022 so far, the highest among Indians, even as several individuals' fortunes plunged amid a turmoil in global markets. As of Tuesday's close, Adani Group Chairman's fortune stood at $96.9 billion. In 2021, Adani added the most wealth among the world's billionaires, as per Hurun.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt to sell up to 1.5% stake in state-run ONGC to raise ₹3,000 crore
text: The government will sell up to 1.5% stake in state-run Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) through an offer for sale (OFS) to raise up to ₹3,000 crore. The government plans to sell 18.87 crore shares at a floor price of ₹159 apiece. The OFS will open on March 30 and March 31 for non-retail investors and retail investors, respectively.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India lost ₹100 crore to bank fraud every day over the past 7 years
text: India lost over ₹100 crore daily to banking frauds or scams over the past seven years, however, there was a year-on-year reduction in the total amount involved, as per RBI data. Maharashtra topped the list, accounting for 50% of the money involved, followed by Delhi, Telangana and Gujarat. From April 2015-December 2021, ₹2.5-lakh crore financial fraud was detected in India.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US oil price drops below $100 mark on positive Russia-Ukraine talks
text: US oil price dropped below the $100 mark on signs of progress in talks between Russia and Ukraine to end their conflict. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $6.41 to $99.55/barrel while Brent crude fell $6.51 to $105.97/barrel. Oil prices were further pressured by lockdowns in China's biggest city Shanghai to curb the spread of coronavirus.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt approves ₹6,000 crore programme to improve MSME performance
text: The Union Cabinet has approved a ₹6,000 crore World Bank-assisted programme to improve the performance of MSMEs. The 'Raising and Accelerating MSME Performance' programme will aim at improving MSMEs' access to market and credit and strengthen institutions and governance. The World Bank will provide a loan of ₹3,750 crore and the Centre will provide the remaining ₹2,312.45 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Petrol price crosses ₹105/L-mark in B'luru, diesel costs ₹90.49/L
text: Petrol and diesel prices were hiked again across the country for the eight-time on Wednesday. Following the latest price revision, petrol in Karnataka capital, Bengaluru, now costs ₹106.46 per litre, while diesel now costs ₹90.49 per litre. Notably, the petrol price has gone up by ₹5.88 from March 21 in Bengaluru, while the price of diesel has increased by ₹5.48.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: ED attaches assets worth over ₹7 cr of TN-based red sandalwood smuggler
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said that it has attached plots, houses and other assets worth ₹7.54 crore of a Tamil Nadu-based alleged red sandalwood smuggler and his family members. The action has been taken against R Selvaraj. "He is a habitual offender who indulged in unlawful activities related to smuggling of red sandalwood and other criminal activities," the ED said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: ICRA slashes India's FY23 GDP growth forecast from 8% to 7.2%
text: India's FY23 GDP growth forecast has been slashed from 8% to 7.2% due to rising commodity prices and supply chain issues caused by the Russia-Ukraine war, ICRA Chief Economist Aditi Nayar said. ICRA also cut FY22's GDP growth forecast from 9% to 8.5%. "Higher prices of fuel and items like edible oils are likely to compress disposable incomes," Nayar added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: IL&FS board resolves ₹55,000 crore debt, around 90% of target
text: Infrastructure Leasing and Financial Services (IL&FS) on Tuesday said its board has resolved debt of ₹55,000 crore as of March-end, which is around 90% of the company's resolution target of ₹61,000 crore. Kotak Mahindra Bank CEO Uday Kotak, who headed IL&FS' board, said he'll step down from his position effective April 2. He'll be replaced by IL&FS MD CS Rajan.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FDI in India rose 65% under PM Modi against 10 yrs of UPA rule: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said foreign direct investment (FDI) in India under Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government was $500.5 billion, 65% more than FDI received in 10 years of the UPA government. According to UNCTAD, India continues to remain among the top five FDI recipient countries in the world, she added. FDI inflow in FY21 was $81.72 billion.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Glasgow University names research centre after Kiran and John Shaw
text: The University of Glasgow has named its new research centre after Biocon Vice Chairman John Shaw and Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw. The £116 million Mazumdar-Shaw Advanced Research Centre will be home to over 500 researchers from a range of disciplines. The $7.5 million donation made by the couple in July 2019 has been used to build the research hub.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India buys 45,000 tonnes of Russian sunflower oil at record high price: Report
text: India has contracted 45,000 tonnes of Russian sunflower oil at a record high price for shipments in April, Reuters reported on Tuesday citing industry officials. The move comes as oil prices in the local market surged after supplies from Ukraine stopped because of the war. Refiners bought crude sunflower oil at a record price of $2,150 a tonne, dealers said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 7th time in 8 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the seventh time in eight days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹100.21/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹91.47/litre from ₹90.77/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹115.04/litre from ₹114.19/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹99.25/litre from ₹98.50/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India-born Raj Subramaniam named new FedEx CEO as Founder steps down after 50 yrs
text: FedEx has named India-born Raj Subramaniam as its new CEO as the company's Founder Frederich W Smith will step down after around five decades, effective June 1, 2022. Subramaniam is currently President and Chief Operating Officer. He will be promoted to President and CEO, while 77-year-old Smith will become Executive Chairman. "Fred is a...legend of the business world," Subramaniam said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who is Namit Malhotra, CEO of VFX company that won 'Dune' an Oscar?
text: Union I&B Minister Anurag Thakur congratulated UK-based Namit Malhotra, the CEO of DNEG visual effects company behind the movie 'Dune', which won the Best Visual Effects Oscar on Monday. Malhotra's DNEG also worked on the movie 'No Time to Die', which was nominated for Oscars. Malhotra's grandfather has worked as a cinematographer, and his father as a producer, in Bollywood.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 20,000 bankers sleeping in offices to beat COVID-19 lockdown in Shanghai
text: Over 20,000 bankers, traders and other workers are sleeping in their office towers in Shanghai's Lujiazui district to keep China's financial hub working through the COVID-19 lockdown. Brokerages, asset managers and financial exchanges in Lujiazui summoned key workers to offices ahead of Monday's lockdown. Arrangements were made for sleeping bags and basic supplies for workers' overnight stays.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: After Heineken, Carlsberg says it will exit Russia
text: Danish brewer Carlsberg has announced that it has "taken the difficult and immediate decision" to exit the Russian market, following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Carlsberg will incur a substantial non-cash impairment charge and will have no presence in Russia after full disposal of its business, the company said. Earlier, Dutch brewer Heineken said it will exit its business in Russia.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Heineken to exit Russia at a cost of $438 million
text: Dutch brewing major Heineken is exiting its business in Russia at an expected cost of $438 million, following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Previously, the beer maker had said that it would only halt new investment and exports to the country. "Heineken's ownership of the business in Russia is no longer sustainable nor viable in the current environment," the company said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No plan to buy crude oil from Russia in Indian rupees: Govt
text: Rameswar Teli, the Minister of State in the Petroleum Ministry, said, "Oil public sector undertakings neither have any contract nor is any such proposal under consideration from Russia or any other country for the purchase of crude oil in Indian rupees." He clarified this in Parliament on Monday. This comes amid Indian companies buying Russian oil following deep discounts.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I'm practically under house arrest, have to eat at home: Sanctioned Russian oligarch
text: London-based Russian oligarch Mikhail Fridman said he's "practically under house arrest" and has to eat at home because all his cards and bank accounts are blocked due to sanctions. "Authorities in Great Britain...assign me a certain amount so I can take taxis and buy food," he told a newspaper. Fridman has a fortune of over $10 billion, as per Bloomberg.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 7 Indian-origin persons charged for insider trading worth million dollars in US
text: Seven Indian-origin persons have been charged by US federal authorities with insider trading in a scheme through which they allegedly made over $1 million in illegal profits. Three of them were software engineers at California-based Twilio. They knowingly tipped off four family members and friends to trade in Twilio's options ahead of its 2020 earnings announcement, according to the complaint.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Stop forcing people to pay for news: Musk to Bezos-owned Washington Post
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has accused the Washington Post of editorialising his comments for a story. "Here's what I actually said: 'If you're so concerned about democracy, stop forcing people to pay for (allegedly) important news! Your boss (Jeff) Bezos can certainly afford it'," Musk wrote on Twitter. Amazon's billionaire Founder Bezos bought the Washington Post in 2013.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹95.86 crore recovered from 11 crypto exchanges for GST evasion: Govt
text: The government has recovered ₹95.86 crore, including interest and penalty charges, from 11 cryptocurrency exchanges for evading Goods and Services Tax (GST), Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. He told the Lok Sabha that the exchanges were investigated for evading ₹81.54 crore in taxes. The biggest evasion was detected at WazirX, followed by CoinDCX and CoinSwitch Kuber.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Hero MotoCorp made ₹1,000 crore bogus expenses, I-T dept reportedly finds
text: The I-T department, in a recent search operation at Hero MotoCorp-linked premises, reportedly found that the company made over ₹1000 crore in bogus expenses. It also found that Chairman and MD Pawan Munjal used black money to pay over ₹100 crore in cash to buy a farmhouse in Delhi, ANI reported citing sources. The company's shares fell over 7%.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tesla adds $84 billion to its value in 1 day, more than Ford's entire market cap
text: Tesla shares added $84 billion to their market value on Monday, more than Ford's entire market capitalisation. The stock surged after the electric car maker said it is planning a second stock split in about two years. Tesla's current market value stands at $1.13 trillion. When Tesla split its stock in August 2020, its share price rose 743% that year.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Bank transactions worth ₹18,000 crore hit by Bharat Bandh: Industry body
text: The All India Bank Employees Association said that the two-day Bharat Bandh against the Central government's policies affecting workers has halted banking transactions worth at least ₹18,000 crore. In the southern grid functioning in Chennai, six lakh cheques couldn't be cleared, AIBEA's General Secretary CH Venkatachalam said. "We regret the inconvenience caused to the banking public," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: It's the stuff of legends: Mahindra on Raj succeeding Fred Smith as FedEx CEO
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra said it's "the stuff of legends" to succeed a legend like FedEx Founder Frederick Smith after India-born Raj Subramaniam was named as the company's new CEO. "Thank you for making us proud. You symbolise the Indian 'Raj!'...(Not the British Raj)," Mahindra wrote on Twitter. Smith will step down as CEO after around five decades, effective June 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Women's feet smell 5 times worse than men's, claims P&G ad; firm issues apology
text: US consumer goods firm Procter & Gamble has apologised for a WeChat infographic that had the text: "Women's feet smell five times worse than men's. If you don't believe it, smell it." P&G removed the advertisement, which was meant to promote fragrant body care products, after backlash in China. "P&G always advocates equal, tolerant and respectful values," the company said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who is Raj Subramaniam, the IITian named FedEx's new CEO?
text: Raj Subramaniam, who will be promoted as FedEx's CEO in June, is originally from Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram and currently lives in Memphis, Tennessee. The 56-year-old has a bachelor's degree in chemical engineering from IIT Bombay and an MBA from The University of Texas at Austin. Subramaniam joined FedEx in 1991 and is currently the firm's President and Chief Operating Officer.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Credit Suisse hasn't pursued new Russian clients since Feb: Reports
text: Credit Suisse has stopped pursuing new clients in Russia since the invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Reuters reported. Roughly 4% of the assets the bank manages belong to Russian clients, CEO Thomas Gottstein had said earlier. The bank has been striving to reduce its business contacts with Russia and helping clients limit their exposure to the country.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 37,000 feature phones users joined UPI service since March 8: Govt
text: Union Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Kishanrao Karad, in a written reply to Lok Sabha, said over 37,000 users have used digital payment services meant for feature phones, totalling 21,833 successful transactions since its launch on March 8. The UPI123 Pay service is meant for feature phones, which can be used by people without the internet.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Japan to ban exports of luxury cars, goods to Russia from April 5
text: Japan has said it will ban the export of high-end cars and other luxury goods to Russia from April 5 in its latest response to Russia's Ukraine invasion. The new items on export control list come under 19 categories. Japan will ban export of cars worth more than $48,630, to jewellery, watches, cosmetics, liquor and art priced at over $324.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: SMEs raised ₹932 crore via IPOs in FY22, 3.8 times more than FY21
text: A total of 67 small and medium enterprises (SMEs) raised ₹932 crore via IPOs in FY22, 3.8 times higher than the amount raised by SMEs in FY21, according to Prime Database. In FY21, 28 SMEs raised ₹244 crore via IPOs. The largest SME IPO in FY22 was of Gujarat-based Aashka Hospitals for ₹96 crore in September 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt's total liabilities in Q3 rise 2.15% QoQ to ₹128.4 lakh cr
text: The government's total liabilities rose 2.15% QoQ from ₹125.71 lakh crore in Q2 FY22 to ₹128.41 lakh crore in Q3. Data released by the Finance Ministry said public debt accounted for 91.6% of total outstanding liabilities in Q3, up from 91.15% in Q2. Commercial banks' share in the government's securities stood at 35.4% in Q3, down from 37.82% in Q2.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Supertech homebuyers and creditors can file claims until April 8
text: Homebuyers and creditors that have invested in Supertech can submit their claims in the realty firm's insolvency case till April 8, Supertech's insolvency resolution professional said.
