The direct tax collection numbers for current financial year stand at ₹13.63 lakh crore as against over ₹9 lakh crore in 2020-21, he said. "The year-on-year net collections today is more by 48.4% over 2020-21," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Adani added ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021: Hurun
text: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani, who ranks 12th on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, added an average of ₹6,000 crore every week to his wealth in 2021, Hurun said. With a net addition of $49 billion, Adani added the most amount of wealth among the world's billionaires. Adani & his family's total wealth is estimated at $81 billion.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Hindustan Petroleum buys 2 million barrels of Russian crude oil: Report
text: The Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd has bought two million barrels of Russian crude oil, PTI reported on Thursday. This comes after reports claimed that the Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) bought 3 million barrels of crude oil from Russia at a steep discount. IOC reportedly bought Urals crude for May delivery at a discount of $20-25 a barrel to dated Brent.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: If Putin is afraid to fight, I'll use only my left hand & I'm not left-handed: Musk
text: World's richest man Elon Musk, who challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to "single combat" amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, tweeted, "If he (Putin) is afraid to fight, I will agree to use only my left hand and I am not even left-handed." Musk tweeted this after Putin's ally Ramzan Kadyrov told Musk, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Crypto produces 17 'known' billionaires worldwide: Hurun Rich List 2022
text: Cryptocurrency has produced 17 "known" billionaires worldwide, according to the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. The pack of 17 billionaires is led by Changpeng Zhao, the CEO of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance. He's followed by Bahamian cryptocurrency exchange FTX's CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. Brian Armstrong, the CEO of Coinbase, is the world's third-richest crypto billionaire.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Musk to exit Miss Universe owner Endeavor's board, firm says 'he has little time'
text: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk will resign from the board of directors of Endeavor, with effect from June 30, 2022. "We know he has a lot of demands and little time and we appreciate the support he provided us," the company said. Endeavor owns the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) and the Miss Universe pageant.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Paytm's target price slashed to ₹450 by Macquarie citing 'tough times ahead'
text: Macquarie has cut its target price for Paytm's parent company One97 Communications Ltd shares by about 36%, to ₹450 apiece, as it sees "tough times ahead" for the company. "With the RBI raising issues with Paytm Payments Bank and Chinese ownership being over 25%, the probability of Paytm getting a small finance banking licence is significantly lower now," Macquarie said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: This looks superb and so inviting: Mahindra on pics of new highway in Manipur
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has praised a new highway built in Manipur. Retweeting a post by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari that featured a few photos of the Wangjing-Khonkhang section of NH-39 in Manipur, Mahindra wrote, "This looks superb and so inviting. The magic of Manipur is now much more accessible. These highways will knit India together even more tightly."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: India & Sri Lanka sign agreement for a $1-billion line of credit
text: The State Bank of India (SBI) will provide a $1-billion credit facility to Sri Lanka for the procurement of food, medicines and other essential items, the Union Finance Ministry said on Thursday. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Sri Lankan Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa in Delhi. The ministers discussed wide-ranging issues, the ministry added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Smoke from a huge fire at Walmart warehouse in US visible from space
text: A plume of smoke emitted from a huge fire at a Walmart distribution centre in Plainfield, US, was so vast that it could be seen from space on Wednesday afternoon, Bloomberg said. A clip posted on Twitter by National Weather Service gave a satellite's-eye view of the smoke spreading across the surrounding area. Twenty-four fire departments are fighting the fire.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Wealthy Russians have up to $214 billion stashed in Swiss bank accounts
text: Wealthy Russians have stashed up to $214 billion in secretive Swiss bank accounts, the Swiss Bankers Association (SBA) has revealed. However, SBA said the amount of Russian wealth held in Switzerland was small compared with total assets held in the country. Switzerland "must do everything possible to turn off the money taps", Social Democrats' co-president Mattea Meyer said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Reliance's drastic action came as a surprise: Future Retail on stores' takeover
text: Future Retail (FRL) has said it's committed to taking all actions "necessary to seek value adjustments and reversal of takeover of stores" by Reliance Industries (RIL). RIL's "drastic and unilateral action" to takeover stores came as a "surprise" to FRL, it added. It also complicated the positive scenario which was building up after the CCI order in December, FRL claimed.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Investors ₹19 lakh cr richer as Sensex adds over 5,000 points in 8 sessions
text: The Sensex added more than 5,000 points and the Nifty50 gained over 1,400 points in the last eight sessions in a row, barring the March 15 trading, making investors ₹19 lakh crore richer, Moneycontrol reported on Thursday. On Thursday itself, investors' wealth increased by ₹4 lakh crore. This comes amid positive global cues, easing commodity prices and declining volatility.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 800 employees fired by UK ferry firm in a 3-minute pre-recorded Zoom video
text: UK ferry company P&O Ferries has fired 800 crew in a three-minute pre-recorded Zoom video, saying that its vessels will now "be primarily crewed by a third-party crew provider". "Your final day of employment is today," an executive said in the video. The company has denied claims that it sent security guards with handcuffs to take crew off the ships.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India has world's 3rd highest number of self-made billionaires: Hurun
text: As per the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, India ranks third in the list of self-made billionaires with 119 such individuals. These individuals have cumulative wealth of $474 billion. China has the most number of self-made billionaires at 1,050, with $3.756 trillion combined wealth, while the US stands second with 523 self-made billionaires, whose combined wealth is $3.554 trillion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex ends 1,047 points higher at 57,864, logs best week in over a year
text: The Sensex jumped 1,047 points on Thursday to close at 57,864 following gains in global markets, a day after US Federal Reserve's first interest rate hike in over three years. The Nifty 50 jumped 312 points to end at 17,287. HDFC and Reliance Industries were among top gainers. The Sensex and Nifty logged their best week in over a year.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: China's richest billionaires gain $71 billion as stocks jump most since 2008
text: The combined net worth of China's 75 richest billionaires surged by $71 billion on Wednesday as stocks across Hong Kong and China jumped the most since the 2008 financial crisis. Tencent's Pony Ma, NetEase's William Ding and Pinduoduo's Colin Huang, added over $5 billion each to their net worths, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex jumps 1,000 points after US Fed's 1st rate hike in 3 years
text: Indian benchmark indices gained over 1.5% on Thursday, tracking gains in the global markets, following the US Federal Reserve's first rate hike in over three years. The Sensex jumped over 1,000 points to trade above 57,800, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped more than 280 points to trade at 17,250 levels. HDFC and Kotak Mahindra Bank were among top gainers.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who are India's 10 richest people and what are their net worths as per Hurun?
text: Mukesh Ambani is India's richest person and 9th-richest worldwide with $103 billion wealth, as per 2022 Hurun Global Rich List. Adani & family are 2nd-richest in India, followed by HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar & family, Serum Institute's Cyrus Poonawalla and ArcelorMittal's Lakshmi Mittal. DMart's Radhakishan Damani & family are 6th richest in India and SP Hinduja & family 7th richest.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: IDFC FIRST Bank's CEO gifts 5,00,000 shares to family of a deceased colleague
text: IDFC FIRST Bank's MD and CEO V Vaidyanathan has gifted 5,00,000 shares of the bank to family members of a deceased colleague. The deceased colleague was "closely known" to Vaidyanathan and the shares have been gifted to back the family's education and financial security, the bank said. Earlier, Vaidyanathan gifted shares to five people including his driver and househelp.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Consumers could lose invested money if they buy crypto assets: EU
text: The European Union's securities, banking and insurance watchdogs in a joint statement warned that consumers risk losing all their money invested in cryptocurrency assets and could fall prey to scams. "Consumers should be alert to the risks of misleading advertisements, including via social media and influencers," the authorities said. They also mentioned energy consumption by some assets.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Reliance, Ola Electric win bids under ₹18,100 cr PLI scheme: Reports
text: Reliance Industries and Ola Electric will receive incentives under Centre's ₹18,100 crore Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme to boost local battery cell production, Reuters reported. Hyundai Motors and Indian jewellery maker Rajesh Exports have also won the bids. Ola Electric and Hyundai will get incentives for 20 Gwh capacity while Reliance and Rajesh Exports have won incentives for 5 Gwh.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Moody's slashes India's FY22 GDP growth estimate from 9.5% to 9.1%
text: Moody's has slashed India's GDP growth estimate for FY22 from 9.5% to 9.1%. According to the rating agency, the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war is expected to cost India a high fuel and fertiliser import bill in FY22, leading to reduced government spending and a reduction in India's GDP growth. Moody's has projected India's year-end inflation at 6.6% in FY22.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Direct tax collection in FY22 stands at ₹13.63 lakh cr: CBDT chief
text: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said direct tax collection for FY22 outmatches revised estimates of ₹12.5 lakh crore after touching ₹13.63 lakh crore. He added that government's cumulative collection through tax deducted at source currently stood at ₹6.79 lakh crore and corporate tax collection stood at ₹7.19 lakh crore. "The numbers are more than what we expected," he said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rajeev Ahuja's term as RBL Bank interim MD, CEO extended for 3 more months
text: RBI on Thursday extended Rajeev Ahuja's term as RBL Bank interim MD and CEO for three more months with effect from March 25, the bank said. Ahuja was appointed as the interim MD and CEO on December 25 after former chief Vishwavir Ahuja's abrupt exit. In an unusual move, RBI also appointed an Additional Director on the bank's board.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in Apr-Jun 2021 amid 2nd wave
text: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in April-June 2021 from 9.3% in the previous quarter amid COVID-19's second wave, according to data released by the government. The rise in unemployment in the second quarter of 2021 was the first such increase since the jobless rate peaked at 20.8% in April-June 2020, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Mukesh Ambani only Indian to enter the top 10 in Hurun Global Rich List 2022
text: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani is the only Indian to feature among the top 10 people on the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. With a 24% y-o-y increase in wealth, Ambani was ranked 9th among the world's billionaires, with his wealth estimated at $103 billion. Gautam Adani & family ranked 12th globally, with their wealth estimated at $81 billion.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India buying discounted crude oil from Russia does not violate US sanctions: US
text: India taking up Russia's offer of discounted crude oil would not be a violation of US sanctions, the White House has said. "Our message to any country continues to be that abide by the sanctions that we have put in place and recommended," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki told reporters at a press briefing on Tuesday.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: It'll be support for invasion: US on if India buys discounted crude oil from Russia
text: On being asked about possibility that India could take up Russian offer of discounted crude oil, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "Think where you want to stand when history books are written in this moment in time." "Support for Russian leadership is support for invasion that is having a devastating impact," she further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Elon Musk changes his Twitter name to 'Elona' as Putin's ally calls him effeminate
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk changed his Twitter name to 'Elona' after Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally and the Chechen Republic's head Ramzan Kadyrov mocked him as "effeminate". Kadyrov said, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's." "You'll need to pump up those muscles...to change from the gentle (effeminate) Elona into the brutal Elon you need to be," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tata Communications becomes Formula 1's official broadcast connectivity provider
text: Formula 1 and Tata Communications on Wednesday announced a multi-year strategic collaboration under which Tata will be F1's official broadcast connectivity provider. Tata Communications will facilitate transfer of over 100 video feeds and 250 audio channels from the racetrack to F1's Media & Technology Centre in the UK. F1 and Tata had ended their eight-year marketing partnership in January 2020.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia's space chief, who called Musk 'little devil', invited him home 6 months ago
text: Russian space agency Roscosmos' chief Dmitry Rogozin, who called Tesla CEO Elon Musk a "little devil" after he challenged President Vladimir Putin for a single combat, praised Musk six months ago. Rogozin even invited Musk to his home in Russia in September and said he'd "already set the teakettle on heat". Rogozin wanted to discuss "exploring the universe" with Musk.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Chinese stocks jump the most since 2008 after $1.5 tn wiped out in two days
text: Stocks across Hong Kong and China witnessed a massive rally after China's state council vowed to keep its stock market stable following a $1.5-trillion wipeout over the past two sessions. The Hang Seng China Enterprises Index jumped 13% on Wednesday, its biggest gain since the global financial crisis of 2008. Chinese technology firms including Alibaba and Tencent gained over 23%.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar's net worth now 4 times higher than Paytm CEO's
text: India's richest self-made woman and Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar's net worth is now nearly four times higher than that of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, as per Forbes data. Sharma's fortune briefly fell below $1 billion on Wednesday, but currently stands at $1.1 billion. Meanwhile, Nayar's net worth stands at $4.9 billion. Both their companies went public in 2021.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Paytm share price drops 71% from IPO price; out of BSE top-100 mcap list
text: Paytm shares dropped to an all-time low of ₹616.55 apiece on Tuesday, leading it to drop out of the BSE top 100-most valued companies by market capitalisation. Following RBI's order on Paytm Payments Bank, its shares crashed 20% in the last two trading sessions. Notably, its share price has dropped 71% from its issue price of ₹2,150 apiece.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma briefly loses billionaire status
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma briefly fell off the list of billionaires on Wednesday, according to Forbes' data, amid volatility in the stock's price movement. The stock recovered some losses on Wednesday after falling 70% below its IPO price in four months. Sharma's current net worth stands at $1.1 billion, as per Forbes' real-time data.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon's demand for $200 mn caused Amazon-Future settlement talks to fail: Report
text: The dispute settlement talks between Amazon and India's Future Retail failed over the US company's demand for the return of at least $200 million it had invested in Future, Reuters reported. Future instead offered a stake of an equivalent amount in one of its remaining group companies after Reliance takes over most of its retail assets. Amazon didn't accept that.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: SoftBank's Munish Varma steps down from Paytm, PolicyBazaar boards
text: Paytm on Tuesday informed stock exchanges that Munish Varma, Managing Partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers, has resigned from Paytm's board "due to personal commitments and other pre-occupations". He has also resigned from Policybazaar's board. Varma's resignation is consistent with Softbank's move globally, as it steps away from board positions after its portfolio companies get listed.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Woman entrepreneur dies by suicide in balcony after cancer diagnosis in Karnataka
text: Female entrepreneur Suma Sathish, who was reportedly the owner of a textile company, allegedly died by suicide in the balcony of her home in Karnataka's Mangaluru in the early hours of Tuesday. Police said she allegedly took the step after being diagnosed with cancer. A case has been registered at Barke Police station.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Air travel may get costlier as ATF prices hit all-time highs after 18% hike
text: Air travel may get costlier as aviation turbine fuel (ATF) prices were hiked by over 18%, the steepest ever increase, to all-time high levels on Wednesday. The prices crossed the ₹1-lakh-per-kilolitre mark for the first time ever after the sixth straight hike this year. Jet fuel makes up for almost 40% of the running cost of an airline.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex jumps 1,040 points to end at 56,817; Nifty above 16,900
text: The Indian benchmark indices recouped the previous day's losses to end in the green on Wednesday amid positive global cues. The Sensex jumped nearly 1,040 points to close at 56,817, while the broader Nifty 50 also surged 312 points to end at 16,975. Ultratech Cement and Axis Bank were among top Sensex gainers, while Paytm ended 7% higher.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex jumps 900 points in early trade, Nifty above 16,900
text: The Indian benchmark indices opened higher on Wednesday amid positive global cues. In early trade, the Sensex jumped more than 900 points to trade near 56,700 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped around 250 points to trade above 16,900 levels. Banks and financials, including IndusInd Bank and Axis Bank, were among top Sensex gainers.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon's $8.5-billion MGM deal cleared by EU antitrust regulator
text: The European Union's antitrust regulator has approved Amazon's proposed $8.5-billion acquisition of MGM Studios after concluding that the transaction "won't raise competition concerns" in Europe. Their combined market shares are low and they have strong rivals, the regulator noted. The deal, which is Amazon's second-biggest acquisition, is still pending approval by the US Federal Trade Commission.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: SC to hear Amazon's plea for protection of Future Retail's assets on Mar 23
text: The Supreme Court will hear Amazon's application seeking relief against the alienation of Future Retail's assets on March 23. Amazon filed the plea after Reliance Industries began taking control of Future Retail's stores across India. The court proposed that Amazon can press for relief during proceedings before the Singapore International Arbitration Centre-governed tribunal.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India had 8.22 cr taxpayers in FY20, will identify more soon: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said India had 8,22,83,407 taxpayers in FY20 out of the total projected population of 136.30 crore (as on March 1, 2021). This includes persons who pay income tax and corporate tax. "The (tax) department seeks to bring more non-filers into the tax net by formulating region-specific strategies...for identifying potential non-filers," she added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: I-T Dept recovers ₹20 crore cash in raids on Omaxe's offices: Reports
text: The Income Tax Department has recovered ₹20 crore in cash after conducting raids on various offices of realty firm Omaxe Limited, ANI reported. The department has also seized "accounts and sales documents which show more than ₹200 crore unaccounted transactions of the company". The raids, which started on Monday, are still underway at 38 out of 45 premises.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Starbucks CEO to step down, Founder Howard Schultz to return as interim CEO
text: Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson will step down from his role on April 4 and Founder Howard Schultz will take over as interim CEO, the company announced on Wednesday. "I feel this is a natural bookend to my 13 years with the company," Johnson said. He will continue in an advisory role to the company and its board through September.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: COVID-19 pandemic caused 93 lakh job losses in Southeast Asia: ADB
text: Lockdowns imposed due to the COVID-19 pandemic caused 93 lakh job losses in Southeast Asia, Asian Development Bank (ADB) said in a report. The job losses pushed 47 lakh people to extreme poverty last year as inequality widened and movement restrictions hit retail and informal sectors the hardest. "The pandemic's impact on poverty and unemployment will likely persist," ADB said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ₹7.34 lakh crore recovered by banks since FY16: MoS Finance
text: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad on Tuesday said banks have recovered ₹7,34,542 crore in the last six financial years and in the first six months of FY22. This includes recoveries in cases of non-performing assets and written-off loan accounts. He added that systematic and comprehensive checking led to unearthing of frauds perpetrated over the years.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 66 FDI proposals from neighbouring countries approved since Apr 2020: Govt
text: India has received 347 foreign direct investment (FDI) proposals from neighbouring countries since April 2020, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry Som Parkash said. The total value of the proposals is about ₹75,951 crore. The highest number of approved proposals, at eight, were from the electronics sector, followed by the automobile and chemicals sectors at seven and five respectively.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Kerala Assembly passes unanimous resolution against LIC IPO
text: The Kerala Legislative Assembly on Wednesday passed a unanimous resolution against the Centre's decision to sell its stakes in insurance company LIC. The resolution, which was moved by Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, urged the Centre to retain its stake in the institution. Vijayan recalled that LIC was nationalised with an aim to protect stakeholders from the exploitation of private companies.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ex-Fortis Healthcare Promoter Shivinder Singh's interim bail plea rejected by SC
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday rejected former Fortis Healthcare Promoter Shivinder Singh's interim bail plea in a money laundering case, NDTV reported. Singh, who was arrested in December 2019, is accused of misappropriating ₹2,397 crore of Religare Finvest Limited's funds. Taking note of "serious allegations" and Singh being a "flight risk", SC rejected the interim bail plea.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt has no plans to introduce cryptocurrency: MoS Finance
text: The government is not planning to introduce a cryptocurrency that will be regulated by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, informed the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday. Cryptocurrencies are currently unregulated in India, he added. ''RBI doesn't issue cryptocurrency. Traditional paper currency is a legal tender and is issued by RBI," he clarified.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Zomato loans $150 mn to Blinkit, buys 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 mn
text: Zomato is loaning $150 million to Blinkit (formerly Grofers) as per its plan of investing $400 million cash in Indian quick commerce over the next two years. The loan's interest rate will be 12% p.a. or higher with a tenor of not more than one year. Zomato is also acquiring a 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 million.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: We're broke, Amazon is driving us to our knees: Future Group to Supreme Court
text: After Amazon objected to Reliance Industries' takeover of several Future Retail stores, the Kishore Biyani-led group told the Supreme Court, "We are broke, we have no money. Amazon is driving us to the knees." "Rents haven't been paid for 2 years...Landlords terminated leases and we had no money to pay them. Reliance signed up with landlords," Future's lawyer said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ukraine's economy could shrink as much as 35% in 2022 if war continues: IMF
text:
Ukraine's economy may contract by 10% in 2022, assuming there's a "prompt
resolution of the war" with Russia, the International Monetary Fund said in a report. If the war continues, Ukraine's economy could shrink by 25% to 35%, the IMF added, citing wartime real GDP data from Iraq, other countries. Ukraine is set to experience a "deep recession", it stated.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Musk shares old fake pic of Putin riding a bear, says he can bring it to fight him
text: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk has shared an old photoshopped picture of Russian President Vladimir Putin riding a bear after challenging him to single combat. In response to Russian space agency Roscosmos' chief Dmitry Rogozin's tweet, Musk wrote, "He can even bring his bear." Earlier, Rogozin quoted a Russian poet's verse to call Musk a "little devil".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia threatened to arrest McDonald's, IBM execs who criticised govt: WSJ
text: Russian prosecutors issued warnings to McDonald's, IBM and Yum! Brands threatening to arrest corporate leaders for criticising the government, the Wall Street Journal reported. The companies that are withdrawing from Russia amid Ukraine's invasion were also warned that their assets could be seized. Yum! Brands, which operates KFC and Pizza Hut, and McDonald's have suspended operations in Russia.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 700 investors face I-T dept's scrutiny for unaccounted crypto transactions: Report
text: India's I-T department is reportedly planning to issue notices to 700 investors over high-value crypto transactions. "We've a long list of people who were transacting in crypto assets but weren't paying tax...[We've] shortlisted about 700 transactions, where tax liability is very high," an official told The Economic Times. They're likely to face 30% tax, penalty and interest, the report said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Alibaba, Tencent lose over $1 trillion in market value over a year
text: Chinese technology giants Alibaba and Tencent have lost more than $1 trillion in combined market value over the last 13 months. The stocks of Chinese tech companies plunged over the past year as the government extended its regulatory crackdown. While food delivery platform Meituan's market value has plunged by $254.6 billion since February 2021, e-commerce platform Pinduoduo lost $217.6 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reliance is acting outside the litigation & taking over stores: Future to Supreme Court
text: Amid the legal dispute with Amazon, Future Retail told the Supreme Court, "Reliance is acting outside the litigation. Reliance is taking over [stores]...We can't do anything." "Not one store has been surrendered. Reliance took away the boards as they're entitled to...our assets are where they are," it said. Landlords terminated stores' leases after Future didn't pay rents, the company added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Zomato, Blinkit sign term-sheet for merger: Reports
text: Online food delivery firm Zomato and online grocer Blinkit, formerly known as Grofers, have reportedly signed a term-sheet for a merger, reports said. The two companies are likely to approach the Competition Commission of India for an approval soon. Zomato currently owns about 10% stake in Blinkit and may reportedly invest more into the cash-strapped startup until the merger closes.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I launched it 6 months ago: Ashneer day after BharatPe unveils gold loan services
text: After BharatPe launched gold loan services for merchant partners, its former founder Ashneer Grover accused CEO Suhail Sameer of taking credit for his segment. He said, "The Gold Loan business was launched by me and Nikhilesh 6 months back...Suhail had no contribution...and is selling lies as he hasn't been able to launch...things which I had planned in last 3 months."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Paytm shares tank another 8% after report on Paytm Payments Bank data leak
text: Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares tanked another 8% on Tuesday even as its CEO denied a report that claimed RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers over data leak to Chinese entities. On Monday, the shares fell around 13%. "It is an absolutely malicious story...We have no server that is outside India," CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma clarified.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Paytm says RBI order on Paytm Payments Bank 'won't impact overall business'
text: After RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers, its parent company, One 97 Communications, in a stock exchange filing on Tuesday said that the measure "will not materially impact Paytm’s overall business." On Monday, Paytm Payments Bank also dismissed a report that claimed that RBI’s action was taken as the bank was sharing information with China-based entities.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Mukesh Ambani's grandson Prithvi seen for first 1st time in public, pics surface
text: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani’s grandson, Prithvi Akash Ambani, was on Tuesday spotted for the first time in public with his mother Shloka Ambani at his nursery school in Mumbai. Prithvi was seen at Sunflower School in Malabar Hill, the same school where both his parents went for their schooling. Akash Ambani and Shloka Mehta had got married in 2019.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Supertech's Noida twin towers to be demolished in 9 secs using over 2,500 kg explosives
text: Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in Noida's Sector 93A will be demolished in nine seconds on May 22 using explosives, said officials. The demolition ordered by Supreme Court will require around 2,500-4,000 kg of explosives, which will be loaded into the structure in 12-15 days. Around 1,500 households in the vicinity will be moved out for around five hours that day.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Billionaire's 31-yr-old son killed by boat propeller while trying to save fiancée in US
text: Juan Carlos Escotet Alviarez, the 31-year-old son of a Venezuelan banking billionaire, died while trying to save his fiancée during a fishing competition in Florida, US over the weekend. Alviarez dived into the water to save his fiancée after she fell off the boat. After entering the water, Alviarez was struck by a boat propeller and died from his injuries.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Indian Oil Corporation buys 3 mn barrels of Russian Urals oil amid sanctions: Reports
text: Amid sanctions against Russia over the Ukraine war, Indian Oil Corporation bought 3 million barrels of Russian Urals oil from Geneva-based trader Vitol for May delivery, said sources. Vitol reportedly sold the cargoes at a discount of $20-$25/barrel to dated Brent. IOC didn't see any issue with the purchase as it wasn't dealing with a sanctioned entity, added sources.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: PNB reports fraud of over ₹2,000 crore in NPA account of ITPCL
text: The Punjab National Bank on Tuesday reported a fraud of ₹2,060 crore in the NPA account of IL&FS Tamil Nadu Power Company Ltd (ITPCL). The bank said it has already made provisions amounting to ₹824.1 crore as per prescribed prudential norms. In February, Punjab & Sind Bank had declared IL&FS Tamil Nadu a fraud account with dues of ₹148 crore.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Pizza topping is not pizza, it'll attract 18% GST: Haryana appellate authority
text: A pizza topping is not pizza and hence it should attract a higher GST of 18%, the Haryana Appellate Authority for Advance Ruling (AAAR) stated in a recent ruling. It noted that a pizza topping can't be classified as "processed cheese" because it has other ingredients like vegetable oil. Pizza topping would merit classification as "food preparation", the authority said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Jack Ma's Ant sells shares in China tech outlet 36Kr Holdings
text: Billionaire Jack Ma's Ant has sold its entire stake in China-based tech outlet 36Kr Holdings, a regulatory filing showed. Ant held about 18% of 36Kr Holdings as of early 2021, Bloomberg data revealed. The shares of Alibaba, which owns a third of Ant, fell 10% in New York on Monday, while 36Kr Holdings tumbled 12%.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bentley to roll out one electric car annually for 5 years from 2025
text: Luxury carmaker Bentley plans to build a new electric car annually for five years from 2025. Bentley, which is targeting to be end-to-end carbon-neutral by 2030, recorded an operating profit of $427 million for 2021, which was $405 million more than in 2020. Bentley's deliveries jumped 31% to 14,659 cars on demand for new hybrid models.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Amazon's ad campaign laughable, attempt to confuse Indian govt: CAIT
text: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said it finds Amazon's claims in a paid public advertisement "sanctimonious and laughable". "They are nothing but a pathetic attempt at buying media legitimacy and confusing the Indian government...about Amazon's persistent violations of India's FDI laws," it added. The traders' body further said the contents of the public notice are mala fide.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reliance buys assets of battery maker Lithium Werks for ₹467 cr
text: Reliance Industries has acquired the assets of battery maker Lithium Werks for ₹467 crore through its subsidiary Reliance New Energy. The acquired assets include Lithium Werks' portfolio of about 219 patents, a manufacturing facility in China, key business contracts and existing employees. Earlier in December, Reliance agreed to buy UK-based sodium-ion battery company Faradion for ₹1,000 crore.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Nearly 6,000 MSMEs got shut down during FY21 and FY22: Govt
text: Minister of State for MSMEs Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma on Monday said 5,907 MSMEs got shut down in FY21 and FY22. In FY21, 330 MSMEs got shut down, which increased nearly 17-fold in FY22 to 5,577 MSMEs. Maharashtra topped the chart with 1,608 MSME shutdowns, followed by 527 in Bihar, 521 in Tamil Nadu and 442 in Uttar Pradesh.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Japanese billionaire who flew to space buys robotics startup Groove X
text: Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa-owned fund has acquired a majority stake in robotics startup Groove X and will move to full ownership in April. The startup's product 'Lovot', an amalgam of "love" and "robot", has wheels and resembles a penguin with cartoonish human eyes, and communicates in squeaks. Maezawa spent 12 days on the International Space Station last year.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Radicon Vedantam's Greater Noida office sealed for non-payment to homebuyers
text: The office of realty firm Radicon Vedantam in Greater Noida's Sector 16C has been sealed for failing to pay ₹4 crore to homebuyers. "We'll seal the offices of other realty firms tomorrow if they don't clear homebuyers' payments,” said VP Mishra, Tehsildar of Dadri. Properties of different developers are likely to be auctioned too for failing to hand over possession.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Will make calibrated interventions to keep fuel prices under control: Govt
text: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Tuesday said the government will make "calibrated interventions" to keep domestic fuel prices under control and "safeguard the interests of the common man". He added that retail prices of diesel and petrol have not been revised since November 2021. Fuel VAT has been reduced by many state governments too.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Do you agree to this fight?: Musk to Putin after challenging him to single combat for Ukraine
text: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday in a tweet tagged the President of Russia's official Twitter account and asked, "Do you agree to this fight?" In an earlier tweet, Musk had said, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." When a Twitter user asked, "Did you think this through?", Musk responded, "I am absolutely serious."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I hereby challenge Putin to single combat, stakes are Ukraine: Elon Musk
text: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I hereby challenge Vladimir Putin to single combat...Stakes are Ukraine." When a Twitter user asked, "Will you be surprised when he (Russian President Putin) accepts your challenge?", Musk responded, "That would be an honour." Musk's tweet garnered users' reactions like, "Go to bed Elon," and "I need some of what you're drinking."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I still own & won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge: Elon Musk
text: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I still own and won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge." However, he added, "As a general principle...It's generally better...to own physical things like a home or stock in companies you think make good products...than dollars when inflation is high." Bitcoin, Ether and Doge prices saw a brief spike after Musk's tweet.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Retail inflation rises to 8-month-high of 6.07% in February 2022
text: India's retail inflation rose to an eight-month-high of 6.07% in February 2022, government data showed on Monday. This is the second successive month that retail inflation has breached the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) upper margin of 6%. The retail inflation, measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), stood at 6.01% for the month of January in 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tata Sons chief N Chandrasekaran appointed as Air India chairman
text: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran was appointed as the chairman of Air India on Monday. His appointment comes a month after he was given a five-year extension in his term as Tata Sons’ Executive Chairman. Meanwhile, Air India is currently looking for a new CEO after the former Chairman of Turkish Airlines Ilker Ayci declined to be Air India's CEO.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Russia offering oil at heavy discount, India looking to buy it: Report
text: India is considering taking up a Russian offer to buy its crude oil and other commodities at discounted prices, Reuters reported. India, which imports 80% of its oil needs, usually buys about 2% to 3% of its supplies from Russia. "Russia is offering oil and other commodities at a heavy discount. We'll be happy to take that," an official said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 'Musk-Putin's fight will be over in 10 secs' says Twitter user; Musk says 'pretty much'
text: Elon Musk responded "pretty much" to a Twitter user who claimed Musk and Russian President Vladimir Putin's "fight" would be over in 10 seconds. The user said, "It'd just depend on how much damage Elon would want to do (and) how fast. Nothing else...Elon is also 19 years younger." This comes after Musk challenged Putin to single combat for Ukraine.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Little devil, you're weak: Russian space chief to Musk on combat challenge to Putin
text: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to single combat, Russian space agency Roscosmos' head Dmitry Rogozin replied with a verse by Alexander Pushkin calling Musk a "little devil". Quoting the poet, Rogozin wrote, "You, little devil, are still young. You're weak to compete with me; it'd only be a waste of time. Overtake my brother first."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: iPhone supplier Foxconn halts production in China's Shenzhen amid COVID-19 curbs
text: Apple iPhone supplier Foxconn on Monday said that it has suspended operations until further notice in China's Shenzhen city after authorities imposed lockdown measures in the tech hub city amid rising COVID-19 cases. Foxconn added it would deploy backup plants to reduce the disruption to production. On Sunday, China reported over 3,000 new daily cases, its highest in two years.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Do not fear: Sea's secretive billionaire CEO to staff on tech firm losing $150 bn value
text: Forrest Li, the 44-year-old secretive billionaire CEO of Singapore-based technology firm Sea Ltd, which owns e-commerce platform Shopee, mobile game Garena Free Fire among other businesses, wrote a 900-word memo to his employees. The memo addressed a $150-billion plunge in his company's value since late 2021. He wrote, "This drop is painful...Do not fear: We're in a strong position internally."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Amazon accuses Future Retail, Reliance Industries of 'fraud' in newspaper ads
text: Amazon on Tuesday took out ads in newspapers, accusing Future Retail and Reliance Industries of "fraud" after Reliance took over several Future stores. Amazon and Future are currently engaged in a legal battle over the ₹24,713-crore Future-Reliance deal. In the ads, Amazon said, "These actions have been done in a clandestine manner by playing a fraud on...constitutional courts in India."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Have no server outside India: CEO denies report of Paytm Payments Bank data leak
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma dismissed a report that claimed RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers over data leak to Chinese entities. He said, "Absolutely false...The RBI in its letter didn't raise concern over any leak of data...We have no server that is outside India, and no foreign national has any access to our servers."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Completely false: Paytm Payments Bank on report of leaking data to Chinese firms
text: Paytm Payments Bank denied a report that claimed that it was punished by the RBI for allegedly sharing information with China-based entities that indirectly own a stake in Paytm Payments Bank. "The report is completely false and simply sensationalising," the company said. Notably, China's Alibaba Group Holding and its affiliate, Jack Ma's Ant Group, own shares of Paytm.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna sent to 14-day judicial custody in co-location scam
text: A Delhi court on Monday sent former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna to 14-day judicial custody in the co-location case. Ramkrishna, who has been accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', was arrested by the CBI a few days back. Earlier, CBI had demanded 14-day custody of Ramkrishna saying that she had been "evasive in her replies".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: A year after Suez Canal blocking, another giant Evergreen ship runs aground in US
text: A year after a giant container ship got stuck in the Suez Canal for nearly a week and disrupted global trade, another Evergreen Marine Corp vessel has run aground. The 334-metre vessel was en route to Virginia when it got stuck in US' Chesapeake Bay. It "isn't preventing other ships from transiting to the Port of Baltimore", an official said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex ends 935 points higher at 56,486, Nifty settles at 16,871
text: The Sensex on Monday climbed 935 points or 1.68% to settle at 56,486, while Nifty 50 jumped 241 points or 1.45% higher to close at 16,871. While Infosys was the top Nifty gainer as it rose close to 4%, Paytm shares fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE on Monday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: China's richest billionaires lose over $52 billion in a day as stocks plunge
text: The combined net worth of China's 78 richest tycoons fell by over $52 billion in a day as Chinese stocks plunged on Monday. Bottled water company Nongfu Spring's Founder and the country's richest person Zhong Shanshan lost the most, with his fortune declining by $5 billion. Tencent's Pony Ma saw his net worth drop by $3.3 billion to $35.2 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Maggi, coffee, tea to get costlier as Nestlé, HUL hike prices: Report
text: Nestlé products like Maggi noodles, Nescafé coffee and Hindustan Unilever Ltd's (HUL) BRU coffee, Taj Mahal tea and Brooke Bond tea will get costlier as the two companies have increased the prices of some of their products, CNBC-TV18 reported on Monday. Maggi noodles are set to get costlier by 9-16%, it added. Taj Mahal tea prices were hiked by 3.7-5.8%.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Air India has 2,657 pending cases in Indian and international courts: Govt
text: Air India has 2,657 cases pending against it in Indian and international courts, VK Singh, the Minister of State for Civil Aviation, informed Rajya Sabha on Monday. These cases related to issues such as employee service matters, consumer complaints and commercial matters. "These cases are against Air India as a legal entity and will remain with Air India," Singh said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Not a VIP, won't be given special facilities in jail: Court denies home food for Chitra
text: A Delhi court remarked that former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna is "not a VIP" and won't be provided special facilities during her 14-day judicial custody. Denying her home-cooked food, it said, "There are inmates who are in their 70s, who eat Tihar jail food. I have myself eaten Tihar...food. It’s good...VIP prisoners want everything...Every accused, every prisoner is the same."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I knew only two words in English when I first arrived in Bombay: Anil Agarwal
text: Anil Agarwal, the 68-year-old billionaire Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources, tweeted, "When I first arrived in Bombay, I knew only two words in English, 'yes' and 'no'." He said, "I held on to my dreams of making it big." He added, "I came to know a cable company was on the brink of bankruptcy...I started dreaming about acquiring that company."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt hasn't agreed to set up regulator for crypto investments: MoS Finance
text: The government has not agreed to set up a regulatory authority for investments in cryptocurrencies, the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, informed the Lok Sabha on Monday. On being asked about policies regarding misleading crypto ads, he replied that the government and the RBI have been cautioning investors about potential economic, financial, legal, and security related risks.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I-T dept conducts searches at real estate group Omaxe's premises
text: The Income Tax Department on Monday conducted searches at premises of real estate group Omaxe. At least 30 locations in Delhi-NCR and few others in Uttar Pradesh and Punjab are being searched on charges of tax evasion, officials said. Searches conducted by the department are linked to alleged irregularities and concealment of income by the company.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's wholesale inflation rises to 13.11% in February 2022
text: Wholesale inflation in India rose 828 basis points YoY from 4.83% in February 2021 to 13.11% in February 2022, as per Commerce Ministry's data. Wholesale inflation was at 12.96% in January 2022. The Ministry said high inflation in February was caused by rising prices of mineral oils, metals, crude petroleum, natural gas and food articles, among other commodities.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ED attached wrong properties of ex-Amrapali Director: Auditor to SC
text: Forensic auditor Pawan Agarwala told the Supreme Court that the Enforcement Directorate has attached wrong properties of Amrapali Group's ex-Director Prem Mishra. These properties need to be detached and auctioned off to generate funds for stalled projects' construction, Agarwala said. SC had directed ED to investigate alleged money laundering by realtors, including Amrapali Group.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bank frauds fell from ₹61,229 cr in FY17 to ₹648 cr in Apr-Dec 2021: Govt
text: Bank frauds recorded a sharp decline over the past five years to ₹648 crore in the first nine months of FY22, Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said on Monday. They stood at ₹61,229 crore in FY17 and at ₹11,583 crore in FY21. According to Karad, improved detection and reporting along with comprehensive steps resulted in the decline.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LIC IPO likely to be launched in mid-May: Reports
text: LIC's IPO may be postponed to mid-May amid rising market volatility due to the Russia-Ukraine war, Moneycontrol reported. India NSE Volatility Index was at about 26 in Mumbai on Monday, 11 points above the required 15 to launch the IPO. If the IPO is not launched before May 12, a new IPO prospectus will have to be filed by LIC.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Interest rate on EPF deposits reduced to 8.1% for 2021-22, lowest in 44 years
text: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has lowered the interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2021-22 to 8.1% from 8.5% in 2020-21. This is the lowest since 1977-78, when the EPF interest rate was 8%. The decision was taken at the 230th meeting of the Central Board of Trustees Employees' Provident Fund.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: How could you say no to this?: Rishad Premji on US author's letter to Monroe
text: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji tweeted a letter written by Nobel Prize-winning US author John Steinbeck, to actress Marilyn Monroe in 1955, asking her for an autographed photo for his nephew-in-law. "He's already your slave...This would make him mine...If you'll do this, I'll like you very much," Steinbeck wrote. Premji tweeted, "How could you say no to a letter like this?"
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World's largest brewer stops sale of Budweiser in Russia, to forfeit JV profits
text: Anheuser-Busch InBev has asked its partner in Russia, Anadolu Efes, to suspend the sale and production of Budweiser beer in the country. The world's largest brewer said it will also forfeit "all financial benefit from the joint venture operations". The announcement comes after Heineken NV and Carlsberg A/S said they would stop producing and selling their beers in Russia.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Meta cuts on-site perks including free laundry, valet service for employees
text: Meta Platforms, Facebook's parent company, has informed its employees about cutting down various on-site perks including free laundry, dry cleaning and valet service. The company also announced that it would delay the free dinner time from 6 pm to 6:30 pm. While Meta offered a remote work option, many employees are scheduled to return to the office on March 28.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Anand Mahindra shares video of Cong leader Deora's music performance, calls him 'cool'
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a video featuring Congress leader Milind Deora, where the latter can be seen playing the guitar onstage at the Mahindra Blues Festival. Mahindra also mentioned that Deora goes by the stage name of MD Mississippi. He wrote, "His party is the INC, & with him, the 'C' stands for Cool!"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Paytm shares fall to all-time low of ₹672 after RBI curbs on Paytm Payments Bank
text: The shares of Paytm fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE in Monday's early deals. This comes after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers until its audit is done. The stock has declined around 70% compared to its issue price of ₹2,150 per share.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Reports on CEO's arrest for rash driving exaggerated, no harm caused: Paytm
text: Responding to reports of Paytm founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's arrest and subsequent bail in a case of rash driving in February, a company spokesperson called it a "minor incident". The spokesperson added that no harm was caused to any person or property due to it and that media reports claiming the nature of the arrest are exaggerated.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Ashneer Grover denies owning ₹10-cr dining table, says 'It's not even worth 0.5% of that'
text: Ashneer Grover has denied a report claiming he spent ₹10 crore on a dining table, saying, "It's not even worth 0.5% of that". He tweeted, "Is it a space rocket? Is it a time machine?...I don't hold Guinness World Record for the most expensive table...Press – don't fall for BharatPe Board (undisclosed sources) lies – you'll lose credibility like them."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: I was there, police were in awe of his humility: Innov8 founder on Paytm CEO's arrest
text: Amid reports of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma being arrested for alleged rash driving in February, the founder of Innov8 has come forward as a witness. Dr Ritesh Malik tweeted, "There was no arrest, no negligent driving...the car didn't even have a scratch. I was there and saw...how he managed the situation was fantastic...Police were in awe of his humility."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: He could've funded it himself: Lawyer on Musk's 'taking Tesla private' tweet
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyer told a US court the billionaire is rich enough that he could've funded Tesla's going-private transaction himself. He was referring to Musk's 2018 tweet claiming he was considering taking Tesla private and that he had secured the funding. The lawyer said, "None of Musk's deals have ever had a funding issue...[He has] great personal resources."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Paytm Payments Bank issues statement after RBI bars it from taking new customers
text: A day after RBI directed Paytm Payments Bank to stop onboarding new customers with immediate effect, the company issued a statement saying they are taking immediate steps to comply with RBI directions. It added, "We shall notify when we recommence the opening of new accounts after obtaining RBI approval." It also said the accounts of existing customers are fully functional.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Russian court allows Peppa Pig piracy without punishment after Western sanctions
text: A Russian court has ruled that Peppa Pig's trademarks can be used by Russian businesses without punishment. Entertainment One, which owns the rights of the cartoon character had asked for 40,000 roubles in compensation from a Russian entrepreneur who had drawn his own version of the character. The court dismissed the case citing "unfriendly actions of US and affiliated countries."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Video shows long car queues outside McDonald's in Russia as brand shuts stores
text: A video showing long queues outside a McDonald's outlet in Moscow has surfaced on social media. McDonald’s has temporarily closed its 847 stores in the country over the Ukraine war. As per the company, the closure will cost it about $50 million a month. Meanwhile, people were also seen selling McDonald's burgers for high prices in Russia online.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I find things chilly, I'm thin: World's largest air-conditioning firm Daikin's CEO
text: Masanori Togawa, the 73-year-old CEO of the world's largest air-conditioning company Daikin, while speaking about his personal air-conditioning usage, said, "I tend to find things chilly; I'm thin and don't have enough muscle!" He told Bloomberg, "But we're based in Osaka, which is brutally hot during the summer. There's no way we can survive there without air conditioning."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Adani, Piramal among 14 firms looking to buy Anil Ambani's Reliance Capital: Report
text: Adani Finserve, KKR, Piramal Finance and Poonawalla Finance are among the 14 prominent firms that have expressed interest in buying debt-ridden Reliance Capital promoted by Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, PTI reported on Sunday. The last date for submission of bids for the firm was extended to March 25. Last year, RBI superseded Reliance Capital's board in view of payment defaults.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World's 5th richest person Buffett got $373,000 in compensation for 2021
text: Berkshire Hathaway's Chairman and CEO Warren Buffett received $373,204 in compensation for 2021, including his salary and security cost, down from $380,328 a year ago. Buffett's 16.2% stake in Berkshire comprises most of his $117.9 billion net worth, making him the world's fifth richest person. Buffett has been receiving an annual salary of $100,000 for more than four decades now.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBI lifts restrictions on HDFC Bank's new digital launches after a year
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has lifted restrictions on HDFC Bank's new digital launches after more than a year, the private lender said. These restrictions were imposed in December 2020, due to instances of outages in HDFC's internet banking services. In 2021, the RBI allowed HDFC Bank to issue new credit cards after imposing a ban for eight months.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Have trouble sitting idle, sitting quietly for 5 mins feels like waste of time: Nooyi
text: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi at the Jaipur Literature Festival 2022 spoke about what motivated her. She said, "When I sit quietly, I feel I have wasted five minutes of my time. I'm constantly thinking about how to change the world or to help somebody...I have trouble sitting idle. That's why meditation has never been a part of my life."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Azim Premji forgives person who filed 70 cases against him; SC praises him
text: The Supreme Court praised former Wipro Chairman Azim Hasham Premji after he agreed to forgive the person who through his companies filed over 70 cases against Premji and his associates. "We're happy to note that Mr Azim Hasham Premji has taken a constructive view of the matter and agreed to forgive the past conduct of Mr Subramanian," the court said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Sanctions have frozen almost $300 bn of Russia's gold, forex reserves
text: Sanctions imposed on Russia have frozen around $300 billion of $640 billion that Russia had in its gold and forex reserves, Russian Finance Minister Anton Siluanov said on Sunday. He added that the West was also pressuring China to limit its trade with Russia. Siluanov said Russia will pay roubles to its debt holders until reserves are unfrozen, RIA reported.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Reduction in EPFO interest rate BJP's return gift after poll win: Cong
text: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said the reduction in Employees' Provident Fund Organisation interest rate was a "return gift" of the BJP to people after it won Assembly elections in four states. "Is it right to attack...savings of crores of employees on...basis of electoral victory?" he asked. EPFO has lowered the interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2021-22 to 8.1%.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Dollar-denominated debt is bad idea, exposes one to Fed's moods: Zoho CEO
text: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that dollar-denominated debt is a bad idea. "They leave companies and the country exposed to the Fed's (the US' Federal Reserve) mood swings," he explained. Vembu was commenting on a Twitter thread by Human Rights Foundation's Alex Gladstein. "The fiat/petrodollar system can be considered a form of neocolonialism," Gladstein wrote in the tweet.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sachin Bansal's Navi Tech files draft papers for ₹3,350 crore IPO
text: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal-led Navi Technologies has filed draft papers with SEBI to raise up to ₹3,350 crore through an initial public offer (IPO), Moneycontrol reported. The offer will primarily consist of fresh issuance of equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. Sachin Bansal co-founded the financial services company with Ankit Agarwal after exiting Flipkart in 2018.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt can float LIC IPO without fresh filing till May 12: Reports
text: The government has time till May 12 to float the LIC IPO without filing fresh papers with SEBI, PTI reported. If the deadline is missed, the government will have to file fresh papers with Q3 FY22 results and an updated embedded value. "We're watching the volatility and will file the red herring prospectus giving price band soon," an official said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LIC reports ₹235 crore net profit in Q3 ahead of IPO
text: IPO-bound LIC's net profit rose from ₹94 lakh in Q3 FY21 to ₹234.9 crore in Q3 FY22 while its net profit between April-December 2021 rose to ₹1,643 crore from ₹7 crore reported last year. First year premiums during Q3 rose 10% YoY to ₹8,748 crore. LIC will offload 31.62 crore shares in the upcoming IPO, its draft papers said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Cooperative sector to contribute hugely in $5 trillion economy goal: Amit Shah
text: Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the cooperative sector is going to make the largest contribution to PM Narendra Modi's aim of making India a $5 trillion economy. He said a strong cooperative sector will also help realise the dream of Aatmanirbhar Bharat. He added that the cooperative sector will benefit several crore people associated with it.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Morgan Stanley cuts India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 7.9%
text: Morgan Stanley has cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 by 50 basis points to 7.9% and raised retail inflation projection to 6%. The firm also expects current account deficit to widen to a 10-year high of 3% of GDP. High oil prices, trade and tighter financial conditions are expected to affect the Indian economy in FY23.
author: Ashley Paul
